items.title: Lead Web Developer at The Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia, PA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Museum
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Job description

The Barnes Foundation is seeking a Lead Web Developer to architect and create the foundation for a number of new technology initiatives ranging from web, wearable, and machine learning technologies. We are looking for someone with a breadth of knowledge including best practices in front and back end coding, systems architecture, and web design to lead us into the near future.

The Barnes is fully rethinking all aspects of visitor facing technology. As such, you will have the opportunity to build our new technology stack—from the web server all the way to frontend libraries—from a blank slate in the way you think will work best for maintainability, scalability, security, and reliability.  While some early decisions have been made, you’ll be working to analyze those choices while thinking about the best past forward for a number of forward-thinking projects. 

In addition to working on new digital projects, you will be responsible for creating technology standards and guidelines designed to foster maintainable coding practices and system design while ensuring these standards are implemented across all consultant projects. You will be responsible for conducting code reviews, security audits and any other inspections necessary to ensure projects meet the standards you will help establish. Projects under your supervision will need to be integrated into our new cloud infrastructure. This may include the creation of continuous integration infrastructure to handle the deployment of these projects as they are developed and maintained, as well as a means of managing the security concerns and many software dependencies these projects will introduce.

In this role, you may be coding projects onsite or overseeing consultant teams across multiple cities acting as a project liaison. As projects launch, you’ll be responsible for server maintenance and maintenance automation, including backups, disaster planning, patching and upgrading. You’ll be reporting to the Chief Technology Officer in addition to working closely with the Deputy Director of Digital Initiatives and Chief Experience Officer.  This position can be performed remotely, but ideally based in Philadelphia or New York City and will require occasional commutes to both of those cities. 

We are open to hiring this role as a full-time or part-time position depending on needs of the right candidate.

About Us:

Established as an educational institution the Barnes Foundation carries out its mission by promoting appreciation of the arts and horticultural science, through the preservation, presentation, and interpretation of the collections of Albert C. and Laura L. Barnes.

Celebrated for its exceptional breadth, depth, and quality, the Barnes Foundation’s art collection includes works by some of the greatest European and American masters of impressionism, post-impressionist, and early modern art, as well as African sculpture, Pennsylvania German decorative arts, Native American textiles, metalwork, and more. The 12-acre Arboretum contains over 3,000 species of woody plants and trees.

The Foundation engages diverse audiences through its exceptional collections and related high-quality programs that reflect a broad range of periods and cultures and build on the founders’ innovative educational vision of transforming lives through the arts and horticulture. 

Skills and Knowledge:

Required:

  • HTML, JavaScript, and frontend frameworks
  • Backend development languages and frameworks (PHP, Ruby, Ruby on Rails,Python, React, etc.)
  • Creating and maintaining cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred)
  • SQL, Relational Database, NoDB, Elasticsearch
  • Third-party REST APIs and API authentication schemes
  • Source control management systems (git preferred)
  • Building and deploying continuous integration solutions
  • Securing web servers and auditing for secure web practices
  • Creating clear and concise coding standards and guidelines
  • Working effectively with remote teams
  • Communication skills including the ability to articulate complex technology concepts to non-technologists

Nice-to-haves:

  • Experience with unit and integration testing systems
  • Experience with managing machine-learning libraries and their dependencies
  • Familiarity with Agile development concepts and practice
  • Familiarity with Microservices/SOA architecture and best practices
  • Familiarity with the Android Studio SDK
  • Familiarity with CMS Engines, specifically Craft CMS

Competitive Benefits Include: Full time—Group health, dental and vision insurance; flexible spending accounts; short and long-term disability and group life insurance; 403(b) with matching contributions; Employee Assistance Program; voluntary benefits; as well as paid vacation, personal time, sick time and holidays. Part time benefits are available depending upon the scheduled hours.

To Apply: 

https://workforcenow.adp.com/jobs/apply/posting.html?client=barnesf&jobId=125869&lang=en_US&source=CC3

Please include your cover letter, a list of three professional references and a resume with your application. Applications that fail to fulfill this requirement will not be accepted. 

The Barnes Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we’re committed to diversity and equal opportunity in our recruitment and hiring. Qualified candidates of all backgrounds are welcome and encouraged to apply for this position.

Employees have rights under other laws including, but not limited to, the Family and Medical Leave Act and the Employee Polygraph Protection Act. We participate in E-Verify.

About The Barnes Foundation

The Barnes Foundation (www.barnesfoundation.org) was established by Albert C. Barnes in 1922 “to promote the advancement of education and the appreciation of the fine arts and horticulture.”

An internationally renowned institution, the Barnes possesses one of the finest collections of impressionist, post-impressionist and early modernist paintings in the world. With particularly extensive holdings of work by Paul Cézanne, Giorgio de Chirico, Henri Matisse, Pablo Picasso, Pierre Auguste-Renoir, Henri Rousseau and Chaim Soutine, the collection also features paintings and works on paper by such American masters as Charles Demuth, William Glackens, Horace Pippin and Maurice Prendergast. Old master paintings, important examples of African sculpture and native American ceramics, jewelry and textiles, and decorative arts and antiquities from the Mediterranean region and Asia round out the collection.

The Barnes serves an audience of some 300,000 annually through active interpretation of its permanent collection; two to three loan exhibitions of modern, contemporary and non-western art and design; an extensive roster of educational programs for children and adults; a growing schedule of public lectures and time-based arts presentations; scholarly and popular publications; and an evolving menu of digital tools and resources available both onsite and online.

Benefits

Learning culture
Great people
Competitive benefits
Magnificent collection

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer at Fieldboom () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: SaaS
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

A Bit About Us

  • First and foremost, we are advocates of small business owners - we know their struggles, we empathize with them and we want to help them grow their businesses
  • We’re building beautifully simple SaaS software to help them collect and analyze feedback that will help them grow their business using data, not guess work
  • We’re a remote team full of razor-sharp engineers, designers, content creators and marketers who love to learn and seek to continually get better
  • Our founder has a product/engineering/marketing background and has launched multiple companies which have generated 9-figures in combined revenue

A Bit About You (As A Person)

  • You are a learning machine - and rarely let a day go by where you don’t learn something
  • You know, like and agree with most of the views shared by the Basecamp guys
  • You value honesty, integrity and hard work immensely
  • You have hobbies outside of work and work doesn’t define you as a person
  • You want to join a team full of smart, creative people you will learn from
  • You’re looking for a career, not just another job

A Bit About You (Tech)

  • You have 2+ years of solid front-end dev experience working on large SPAs
  • You work well with back-end developers and have a good understanding of (and respect for) the relationship between product managers and engineers
  • You’ve been part of a remote team before or you’ve freelanced for at least 2 years

In terms of languages, frameworks, etc, here’s what we’re using right now - and what you’ll need excellent familiarity with to be a great fit for this role:

  • React
  • React DnD
  • Redux
  • Immutable.js
  • SCSS
  • Jest
  • Docker

What You’ll Do

  • Build out the front-end components that we’ll re-use as we’re building the product
  • Work closely with our other engineers to build new features that will help our customers collect, analyze and use feedback to grow their businesses
  • Fix front-end related bugs, performance issues, etc as they arise
  • Write highly readable, highly performance code that’s easy to pick up by other devs
  • Wear many hats - you know that’s the reality when you’re part of a small team

We Are For You If…

  • You want to learn from a founder who has launched multiple companies and see a job not just as a way to write code and get paid for it, but as a great learning opportunity
  • You value a team that works both hard and smart - who are obsessed with helping customers and honing their craft more than anything
  • You actually want to love your job, the people you work with and the software you help create, instead of simply tolerating them

Please note: this is a full-time equivalent contract role for 40 hours per week. We are looking for someone long term, however we are headquartered in Australia so you will be paid for hours worked, not a salary.

About Fieldboom

Fieldboom makes it easy to capture leads, feedback, job applicants and everything else you need to grow your business using beautifully crafted online forms and surveys.

Benefits

Work from anywhere
Experience team of ex-founders
Autonomy, mastery & purpose

items.title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Web Stack C#, Azure; opt Angular 2+ & .NET Core) at Trainer Road, LLC (Reno, NV) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Health & Fitness
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Compensation: $100,000
Openings: 3

Do you do your own dishes? We've got a job for you (and it's not dishwashing ;-) ).

Do you put them in the sink and expect someone else to do them? Move on, please.

Do you get pissed (in a professional way) when someone else leaves their dishes in the sink?  Please apply!

TrainerRoad is looking to expand our engineering group. We're looking for smart software engineers who "get things done". We’re interested in remote candidates in the USA or candidates interested in working in our Reno office.

Areas of work include Xamarin iOS/OSX/Android, WPF, ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Core, Web API, HTML/Javascript, Angular2, Azure, DocumentDB, ANT sport devices, Bluetooth Smart sport devices, Build/Test integration, and SQL among others.

We're looking to hire three engineers to expand our web team. Inside of that team people usually focus on one of the following areas:

Backend Development - Controllers, API, Services, Azure data stuff, Integrations, etc

Frontend Development - Angular2, API, Controllers

TrainerRoad handles a large amount of data and our site gets a lot of use by a set of passionate users. On the backend, you might enqueue millions of items to process via Azure Functions or WebJobs (quickly and efficiently).  On the frontend, you'll be writing code that handles multiple requests per second.

What I'm saying is your code will matter.

We've also got a crack design team. They make it so engineers never have to write a single line of CSS!

Note: We're not on ASP.NET Core yet but we'll move there as soon as EF catches up with our requirements.

Who We're Looking For

We want smart engineers! The ideal candidate is a "developer's developer" and enjoys reading about programming in their free time, tinkering on the weekends with side projects and staying abreast of the latest frameworks/technologies in their area of expertise.

We basically want someone with a passion for development.

Required Technology Experience

  • C# Experience - Intermediate to Advanced proficiency

Optional Technology Experience

  • ASP.net MVC
  • ASP.net Core
  • Javascript Frameworks (Angular2, React, etc)
  • LINQ
  • Web API
  • Azure
  • DocumentDB
  • SQL
  • HTML
  • Build/Test CI (We use TeamCity)

Work Remote or in Reno, Nevada

We're looking for the best candidate we can find in the US. Over half of our development team works remotely. It works very well with the help of Slack and Github.

We expect remote employees to overlap at least 6 hours with the Reno, Nevada office (we're there 8am-5pm Pacific time).

Salary

We're looking to hire engineers for 100k/year.  If you ask for more we'll reject your application. If you're interested in the company please subscribe to our RSS feed at jobs.trainerroad.com for when a higher level job posting is open.

Perks

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • 401k with 4% company matching 
  • 99% of employees individual health care paid (I know 99% is weird...it's an ACA thing and it ends up being just a few dollars per paycheck)
  • Flexible schedule
  • Access to the latest fitness devices (power meters, trainers, sensors, etc.)

Your Resume should have...

  • Links to any open source projects you've contributed to
  • Github/StackOverflow username if you'd like
  • Examples of experience in the "Optional Technology Experience" area

Your Cover Letter should have...

  • Let us know why you want to work for TrainerRoad

We also Require...

The best engineers only want to work with other great engineers. We've found that the best way to find great engineers is to actually have them code, not just answer trivia questions during an interview.

That's why we require applications to do a refactoring exercise as part of their job submission. The right candidate won't find this a pain in the ass; it should be enjoyable.

This also weeds out the vast majority of candidates who just fire off resumes everywhere.

You can download the refactoring exercise here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/95pt8m84znr1jf7/bike-distributor-refactor.zip?dl=0

It has a readme.txt in it with instructions.

Excited about our Company?

In your application let us know why you want to work with us and why you think you'd be a good fit for our company.

FAQs

Do I have to be a cyclist to apply?

Nope! Not everyone in the company is a cyclist. It helps if you're an active racer but it's not required. If you are a racer or TrainerRoad user let us know!

What's unlimited vacation mean?

The CEO of TrainerRoad used to be an engineer at a Fortune 500 company where life was a grind. We believe employees put out their best work when they are happy and not burnt out.

If your brain just isn't working at 3 pm, we encourage employees to go home and rest up. It does no one any good to sit and stare at the computer screen for another two hours. We don't track that time.

Employees generally shoot for around four weeks of REAL vacation time (no slack checking) but some take more and some take less.  The thing we care about is how productive you can be and how much value you can add to the company. Bottom line, we want people who are passionate and get things done. If you meet those requirements everything else works itself out.

That being said, if you end up taking massive amounts of vacation, come in late, leave early and aren't producing outstanding work we're going to have a problem.

How do you work?

We're big believers in Deep Work and Flow. If you're not turning off Slack (snooze), going DND on your phone and shutting off the world for multiple hours a day you're probably not being as productive as you could be. The idea is a developer should be able to work on a chunk of work that they understand totally distraction free for multiple hours.  This is the only way the company moves forward.

We try to work as pragmatically as we can.  We have excellent designers on staff who go from mockups to responsive HTML with light javascript work.

Development uses Github with a strict pull request process. We test, comment, refactor and improve each other's pull requests.

We have partial test coverage and we're constantly improving in that area.

We have a QA team (we call them the Test Team) that checks every PR and does full regression checks for each release.

We have an Automation Team that only focuses on writing UI tests to speed up testing and find bugs faster.

We can one-click deploy our app on Alpha, Beta, and Production channels.

We can one-click deploy our website to Azure (includes smoke tests and warm up).

We have nightly builds that deploy to Test Flight and Google Play.

We often pair program via Screen Hero.

We work off bi-weekly sprint issue lists on Github.

Developers get the super fast machines and awesome equipment. If it's going to let you be more productive we want to spend the money on it.

You didn't ask about education, what's required?

Please put your education on your resume, but we're not going to reject someone because they don't have a degree in Computer Science. We understand that some of the best and most passionate engineers are self-taught.

How long until I hear a response from you guys? What's the process?

If you don't follow directions in this job posting you'll be immediately rejected.  

If you did follow directions our goal is to review your refactoring within a week of submitting your application. All refactoring reviews are done "blind"; meaning the reviewer doesn't know your name, resume or where you're from.  Code is code and it should be reviewed that way without bias.

If we like you're refactoring we'll have you do a coding logic quiz.  Nothing super deep CS wise.  We've found that the candidates who do the best on these exercises are very successful at TrainerRoad.

We'll take the top combined refactoring and coding quiz results and set you up for a team interview.

If the team likes you; we'll then set up a pair programming session with you and our CTO.  We'll give you a tour of our codebase and work on a real issue. This gives you a chance to run away from our codebase screaming and also demonstrate that you can communicate with us.

If all of the above is good, you're hired!  

I know this sounds like a lot of hoops to jump through but it works so so well!  Once you're onboard you'll love that everyone else went through the same process and is up to "your level" in terms of "get-shit-doneness".

What's with the dishes analogy?

Doing your own dishes is a GREAT analogy for our culture.  Don't leave shit around for someone else to clean up.  Do your own dishes.  Do you see someone making a mess? Let's discuss it (in a productive manner) so that we can nip that behavior in the bud.

We know we're really doing well when someone points out a manager not "doing their dishes" or causing an extra headache for a process that doesn't add value (it happens). Seriously, we need employees to call managers out on this.  I'm the CEO writing this; please oh please tell me if I'm messing up or not walking the talk.

This is the longest job posting ever, when does it end?

Right now! Congrats if you made it this far! We look forward to looking at your resume and refactoring exercise.

About Trainer Road, LLC

Perks

  • Competitive Pay
  • Unlimited Vacation
  • 401k with 4% company matching 
  • 99% of employees individual health care paid
  • Flexible schedule
  • Access to the latest fitness devices (power meters, trainers, sensors, etc.)

Benefits

Unlimited Vacation
99% of Employee Health Insurance Paid
Fitness Minded Culture
401k with 4% matching

items.title: Full Stack Developer at Neill Technologies () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Beauty, Point of Sale
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We are looking for an exceptional individual to join our growing team of developers, working within the amazingly vibrant Salon and Spa world. As part of our team, you will own and drive technical projects from specification through to delivery and beyond. If you get a buzz from taking initiative, redefining expectations, building champion software and getting involved in challenging technical debates with the team, this is the place for you.

 We are offering a flexible work at home environment: no more office commute!

Responsibilities

Reporting directly to the CTO, you will have ownership of building product components from the design stage, right through to production.  

  • You will deliver complete solutions to business problems, 
  • You will shape product direction and roadmap choices.
  • You will design and deliver beautiful, scalable and robust solutions.
  • You will help build a friendly, supportive engineering team and culture

 Job Role

  • Hands-on development: analyze product specifications, design implementations, write code and rapidly deliver features.
  • Develop engaging and robust digital experiences to complement our entire product suite.
  • Contribute technical ideas and suggestions to enhance the direction of the product.
  • Write efficient, maintainable and reusable code and associated unit tests.
  • Be an efficient and responsible team member, communicate, participate and help
  • Help to mentor other members of the team and contribute to system architecture and development process.
  • Work with QA in a biweekly release cycle.
  • Be enthused about teamwork in an AGILE environment: attend daily stand-ups, plan and demo your projects.
  • Work with our outsource partners to ensure all work meets our exacting standards.

Skills & Requirements 

  • Full Stack developer with several years of relevant experience.
  • Product-focused, Agile application development experience.
  • Evidence of delivering consumer facing, mass market, networked, high-performance web and/or mobile applications.
  • Up to date with the latest application trends and technologies.
  • Good understanding of data structures, design patterns, and modern programming practices.
  • Understanding of analytics, remote reporting and measurements.
  •  Experience of working with Continuous Integration (CI) and Unit Testing.
  • Experience in application performance tuning.
  • Strong design sensibilities
  • Experience building beautiful, responsive and high-quality systems.

 Technical Skills 

  • at least one of Angular 2+/Angular/React (preferably Angular 2+)
  • HTML5/CSS and relevant build tools
  • Node.js
  • Lambda & AWS api Gateway
  • Express.js
  • RESTful api experience
  • Automated testing

also nice to have:

  • Dynamo/Mongo/Cassandra
  • Python
  • Java
  • ElastiCache
  • Oracle

About You:

  • Self-motivated and able to achieve deadlines and work independently.
  • Love to write clean, reusable code and have a passion for web/mobile development.
  • Solid communication skills and team-working capability.
  • Positive and logical approach together with willingness to learn.
  • Attention to detail and a passion for quality.
  • Ability to work remotely, be self-motivated and disciplined in work/life balance.

About Neill Technologies

SalonBiz was the first software management system in the beauty industry. We created it primarily as a tool to help our industry to measure and track performance. In today’s competitive market, SalonBiz remains the top software solution.

SalonBiz was created by Neill Corporation almost 30 years ago, before most salons had computers—but we’ve been in the beauty industry for over 70 years, building software and running our own chain of award winning salons, spas and barber shops. And here’s what we know to be true:

Relationships are what make the beauty industry unlike any other.

When you live it and love it like we do, you help grow it, from the salon’s bottom line to the individual stylist’s paycheck.

When our industry friends experience wild success, or get up and try again, they share their experiences with us. It’s those stories that built this software.

That’s why over half of theSalon Today200 salons use SalonBiz.

Thanks to this group of innovators, our software is a collective intelligence for growth.

Benefits

Work from Home
Flexible Working Hours

items.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer in Seattle/Portland/Vancouver at PipelineDeals (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: CRM, Platforms, SaaS
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Work with a team of smart, highly productive engineers who care greatly about the code they are shipping. Our culture is very DevOps centric with the goal of bringing the most value we can to our business through a streamlined CI/CD pipeline. Our team champions learning, bettering themselves, and teaching to the rest of the team. In addition to working with a great team and shipping a great leading SaaS product, one day every two weeks you'll invest in yourself. You can use that time to learn about new technologies, contribute to open source, or create side projects that help the company. The position is local Seattle, but will consider remote.

Requirements

  • You have over 7 years of professional software engineering experience.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience working directly with Ruby, either with a company, or via open source. Past contributions to open source projects, or maintaining your own, are looked very highly upon.
  • You have extensive Javascript experience. We utilize client-side Javascript frameworks, so knowledge of React and other popular frameworks is preferable.
  • Continually learning and furthering yourself is a priority. We foster a strong culture of learning within the team.
  • You should have a strong understanding of relational SQL databases and query optimization. We use MySQL and Postgres.
  • At PipelineDeals, the product engineers also own the production infrastructure. Previous experience with configuration management, AWS, and other operations related tasks are a big plus.
  • You thrive on continuous improvement values and can help contribute and lead the team to always get better.

About PipelineDeals

PipelineDeals is a fast-growing CRM technology company “built by salespeople for salespeople.” Founded in 2006, we have grown to 3,000+ global customers across 100+ countries. Our SaaS platform is optimized for small-to-medium businesses (SMB) frustrated with overpriced/over-engineered CRM solutions like Salesforce. We give SMBs a competitive advantage when they go up against more established competitors or enter a market for the first time.

PipelineDeals’ users win because our services delivers easy-to-use sales automation tools, intuitive workflows and great customer service. When users find us, they like us — 98% of our accounts renew every year. Our future roadmap includes exciting innovations in AI/machine learning, predictive analytics and voice/mobile to build on this platform. We also plan to optimize the PipelineDeals user experience to ease the burden of entering and maintaining CRM data. Most importantly, in order to stay true to our simplicity roots and meet the needs of our customers, UX and Product Design will have an increasingly-central role in our future product strategy.

This unique vision and market opportunity attracted top angel investors in 2014, including Mike Galgonand Geoff Entress . PipelineDeals is profitable and has had 30+% YOY growth the last few years — the timing is great for you to join our growth story!

Our culture/core values (“YEOMANS”): You matter, customers matter; Everyone is responsible; Operational awesomeness; Must. Always. Stay. Hungry.; Anticipate customer needs; Never stop learning; Seek solutions.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Benefits

Annual all company retreat (Boulder, Costa Rica, San Diego, Aspen...)
Unlimited PTO
We'll pay for conferences, books, screencasts and hardware.
Competitive, better-than-market salary

items.title: Senior Full-Stack Rail Developer at USA TODAY NETWORK (Cambridge, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Digital Media, News
Company size: 5k-10k people
Company type: Public

Job description

Buying stuff is easy. Buying the right thing is hard. That’s where we can help. Reviewed.com, a part of the USA TODAY Network, brings consumers the most scientific and trustworthy reviews available, written by our team of experts. We believe that tough, objective reviews are the best way to analyze products. We provide readers with insightful, practical, and entertaining stories that help them make informed decisions.

Reviewed is looking for a talented developer to join us as we extend our unique homegrown publishing platform and work to scale with our quickly growing user base. We have gone beyond traditional publishing platforms to build a dynamic application to help consumers find the best purchasing options on the products we recommend. The right candidate will help to make this platform better. 

The ideal candidate is a self-starter with knowledge of database design and hosting infrastructure, who also is interested in good front-end UI and Javascript applications, and who loves to build useful software. Experience leading a team is a bonus. 

We are looking for candidates preferably in the Boston, MA or Pittsburgh, PA area but would consider someone remote. 

What is needed 

  • Proven expertise with Ruby on Rails development, developing well-tested and organized applications 
  • Experience developing JavaScript-driven applications, especially in Angular.js, using single-page-architecture or similar backed by a server-side data model 
  • Excited about optimization, performance and scaling to deliver great content to millions of users 
  • Interest in crafting an excellent user experience, both for the reader and for the publishing teams 
  • Excellent communication skills. We communicate constantly via chat and video about ideas, issues, and to help each other out 
  • A desire to be part of a small team where your opinions, ideas and creativity are valued 

Technical skills required 

  • Real-world web development with Rails and/or Node.js, C#, Java, Python, etc. 
  • PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, noSQL 
  • Test-driven development using Rspec, Minitest or similar 
  • Familiarity with Javascript frameworks (Angular.js, or Ember, React) and jQuery 
  • Real-world web development with Bootstrap, HTML, CSS / SASS, and JavaScript / CoffeeScript 
  • Working knowledge of Go and Node.js, or ability to learn 
  • Basic git usage and git-flow workflow 
  • Deployment and management of applications on Heroku and AWS-based infrastructure 
  • Service-oriented architectures and API design and integrations 

About USA TODAY NETWORK

USA TODAY NETWORK is one of the top 20 digital companies in the country, sharing the list with Google, Facebook, and Amazon. And we have over 100 million unique visitors a month, which is more than Buzzfeed, Yahoo News, and Huffington Post. We have a loyal following based on a combination of trusted, fact-checked journalism, paired with a deep commitment to helping our local communities, and constantly pushing our content delivery to be first-of-its-kind in the tech-space. And with over 110 local properties, you’ll have the luxury of living in a community you love while making a national impact.

We have a work hard, play hard mentality in a casual work environment with fun perks including:

  • Ping pong, foosball, and pool 
  • Outdoor patio workspace
  • A beautiful campus with a pond and walking path
  • On-site gym, post-office, and Starbucks

Benefits

Workplace Flexibility
Recognition and Rewards
Medical/Dental/Vision
401k
Paid Time Off
Social Events
Snack Room
Gym
Commuter Benefits

About this job

Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: eCommerce, Fishing, Retail
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

The development team at Catch Co works together to build a digital platform that serves as the foundation for running and scaling all aspects of our fishing subscription box, Mystery Tackle Box. Examples of past and current projects include migrating off legacy platforms, scaling up our custom subscription service with distributed production systems, and generally building internal tools to improve business processes.

What makes this a special opportunity:

  • In this role, you'll be working on the cutting-edge in the Microsoft .NET ecosystem (.NET Core, ASP.NET Core, Azure PaaS) and applying established patterns, such as CQRS, actor model and event sourcing, to create high-performance, scalable solutions.
  • We are a dynamic early-stage startup with tons of momentum (ranked #435 on the 2017 Inc. 500 list of the fastest-growing private companies)
  • We place a premium on building a great culture made up of great people
  • You will work with and learn from experienced leaders who have a track record of building successful companies
  • Work remotely! Other team members work from home throughout the United States.

We look for a track record of the following:

  • Developing web applications using C#, ASP.NET MVC/Web API, JavaScript, TypeScript, Angular 2+, and ReactJS.
  • Building robust and scalable distributed systems for production.
  • Quickly obtaining a deep technical understanding of new domains.
  • Picking out and solving the most important problems as part of a team.
  • Effective use of the Git source control system to branch, merge, and create pull requests.
  • Staying abreast of current topics and trends in the larger software development community.
  • Passion for software development and technology.

What you will do:

  • Collaborate with members of the digital product and development teams to discuss, architect, and implement solutions.
  • Carefully write bug-free code with high-quality unit tests.
  • Subject your code to peer review and participate in reviewing the code of other team members.
  • Profile and optimize your code to ensure scalability and performance in a distributed production environment.
  • Research and surface new ideas and approaches, whether it’s a new software pattern, tool, framework, library, or process improvement for the team.

You must be eligible to work in the United States. Visa sponsorship is not available.

About Catch Co

We're building a personalized, digital shopping experience that introduces anglers to the best new gear and lifestyle apparel. It all started with our monthly fishing subscription, Mystery Tackle Box, and has grown into additional brands including creating many of our own physical products.

We work together to build a digital business platform that serves as the foundation for operating and scaling all aspects of our business.

Examples of past and current projects include migrating off legacy platforms, scaling up our custom subscription service with distributed production systems, and building internal tools to improve business processes.

We collaborate frequently to reduce technical debt and optimize our codebase through refactoring and peer code reviews. We move quickly and are not afraid to try new things.

We keep meetings to a minimum. We do daily standups but digitally and quickly. We meet weekly to discuss project trajectory and groom the roadmap. We also meet once per week to discuss the architecture and code trajectory so our tech debt stays manageable.

Benefits

Health, Dental, and Vision Benefits
401K Plan
Flexible Schedule
Remote/Telecommute
Stock Options
Highly Collaborative Team

items.title: Software Engineer (Remote) at Thycotic (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cybersecurity
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

POSITION SUMMARY

Working as a Software Engineer at Thycotic means being a part of a highly capable, collaborative and agile development team. Thycotic is creating awesome software that’s used by thousands of IT professionals all over the globe.

This is a remote/telecommute position based out of your home office. Reports to the Software DevelopmentTeam Lead. 

REQUIREMENTS

  • You have a minimum of 5 years of experience in C#, ASP.NET, HTML, MS SQL Server, Javascript, JQuery and related technologies. Strong design skills and full software development lifecycle experience required.
  • Experience with front end JavaScript libraries such as Angular is a large plus.
  • You have a strong understanding of Object Oriented principles, the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, relational databases, and web application development.
  • You’re passionate about writing quality code and constantly honing your development skills.
  • You can quickly read and understand both new and existing code.
  • You can look at the “big picture,” coming up with great new ideas, but also executing those ideas and writing the code to make it happen.
  • You thrive in a highly collaborative, flat environment. There’s not a lot of hierarchy or red tape here.
  • You have experience with large codebases and unit testing – mock frameworks, web testing, database testing, etc.
  • You have a strong understanding of Object Oriented principles, the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, relational databases, and web application development.
  • You want to develop using Test Driven Development.
  • You want to develop using pair programming.

Thycotic is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, national origin, color, religion, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Upon conditional offer of employment, candidates are required to complete a criminal background check and drug screen per Thycotic employment policy.

About Thycotic

Thycotic, a global leader in IT security, is the fastest growing provider of Privileged Account Management solutions that protect an organization’s most valuable assets from cyber-attacks and insider threats. Thycotic’s award winning cyber-security solutions minimize privileged credential risk, limit user privileges, and control applications on endpoints and servers.  

  • We have over 7,500 customers worldwide ranging from small IT shops to Fortune 500 companies.
  • Rated #1 in customer satisfaction, achieving a 99% customer satisfaction rating year-over-year.
  • Among Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Companies with 247% annual growth over the past 3 years.

Benefits

20 days of PTO
Top tier, fully loaded health
401k with matching
Company events and outings

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Banking, Financial Technology, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 5k-10k people
Company type: Public

Job description

We’re looking for a Product Designer that has a passion for problem solving. Come join our small, but growing, team for the Banno Platform at Jack Henry. You will be working with a team of 4 other Product Designers that are distributed across various locations for Jack Henry & Associates. As a Product Designer, you’ll get the chance to make a real, positive impact on people’s lives. Our mission is to give people the best possible experience they can have with their finances. We’re doing this by reimagining the online banking ecosystem and building products that empower and delight. As a Product Designer you will facilitate the design of consumer and enterprise user experiences that span across the web, mobile and beyond.

About Jack Henry & Associates, Inc.®

We are committed to creativity, thoughtfulness, culture, and openness—the perfect place to make phenomenal products that have a meaningful impact. Our work environment echoes a modern tech startup but we have the security and benefits of a large, publicly traded company. With our small team of product designers, we place a high value on individuals who can work across the design disciplines of IA, UX, and visual design.

Our team is distributed and that means you can live and work wherever you want–as long as your work hours match US business hours. Travel will be up to 5% for professional development conferences, onsite user testing, and or company meetings.

Benefits

Flexible Work Hours
Remote Work Opportunities
Competitive Salaries

Awesome Health Insurance
Excellent PTO & Paid Holidays
Casual Business Attire
Paid Parental Leave
Forbes Top 100 Best Places to Work 2017 (#7 in IT)

items.title: Senior Software Engineer at LocusLabs (Oakland, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Role: Mobile Developer

Job description

Are you interested in mapping the inside of every building on the planet? So are we!

LocusLabs (http://www.locuslabs.com) is a venture backed SF Bay Area startup focused on indoor mapping and location services. After gaining significant traction in the travel industry providing interactive maps of the world's largest airports to several marquee customers, we are now setting our sights on the rest of the planet.

At LocusLabs, we work on and with a wide spectrum of technologies in order to achieve our goals.  If there are technologies you enjoy working on or that you are interested in working on, we probably have you covered.  From mobile to cloud, GUI to backend, hardware to software, we touch it all.  If you wanted to, you could be working on solving a problem with our sensor fusion system one day, then working on our cloud asset deployment system the next.

Are you a dynamic engineer who likes working on cutting edge technology in a fast paced startup environment? Does the prospect of being able to learn a multitude of new technologies, languages and platforms excite you? Are you interested in traveling the world building relationships with our global customer base? Do you work well on a team and have excellent verbal and written communication skills?

If you said yes to one or more of those, we want you on our team!

Our goal is to hire the best people possible regardless of physical location and/or work schedules, so we are open to telecommuting and flexible time schedules.


JOB DESCRIPTION

  • Member of a very experienced engineering team in an exciting startup environment
  • Define / design / implement features throughout our technology stack including, but not limited to:
  • GUIs and APIs for customer facing iOS, JS and Android SDKs
  • REST / AWS-based APIs
  • Analytics and data analysis
  • On-site data collection systems
  • Mapping workflow systems
  • Interact with product team to scope and prioritize features
  • Work with mapping and data teams to hone workflow
  • Support customers to quickly solve integration and end-user issues

REQUIREMENTS

  • Open to learning new languages and platforms
  • Must be able to task swap between disparate technologies
  • BS or higher in CS or similar field
  • 5-10 years professional development experience
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to overcome obstacles autonomously, self-motivated, “get it done” attitude
  • Willingness to travel internationally on occasion

TECHNOLOGIES

Ideal candidate would have experience with some subset of the following:

  • JavaScript - browser and node
  • Android
  • iOS
  • Maps & geographic coordinate systems - Google Maps / Apple Maps / MapBox
  • Augmented Reality
  • OpenGL / WebGL
  • AWS - Lambda / S3 / DynamoDB
  • REST / HTTP

Salary based on experience; Meaningful stock options; Full-time position.

About LocusLabs

LocusLabs provides the platform and tools that enable apps to be location-aware on a micro level.

LocusLabs is going a level deeper than existing mapping solutions. We are mapping not only places, but people, products and things using technology that scales. We take painstaking effort to ensure we are creating an indoor location experience that is actually useful to people - not just a set of app features.

We build maps that matter.

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
Full Stack Developer - Jobmote

Full Stack Developer

Planning Center

At Planning Center, we build powerful, beautiful applications specifically for churches. Each of our apps has a dedicated team of designers and developers who are committed to refining and expanding their specific app in response to real customer needs. Our customers include 90 of the 100 largest churches in the country, but also small community and neighborhood churches, and we strive to make day-to-day operations easier for all of them.

We’re a development driven company — over half our staff are either developers or designers who code, and even our founder spends much of his time programming — and we’re seeking another developer with expertise in Ruby on Rails, ES6, and React to help make our software even better.

Developers at Planning Center are:

  • Invested. We care about the products we create and the people we create them for, and we all contribute to the vision and direction of our apps. Every one of our developers is critical to their team.

  • Curious. We aren’t afraid to ask questions, experiment, and iterate. We also love playing with fun new technologies like Go and Elixir, and we have Free Weeks every few months for exploring projects that spark our interest.

  • Humble. We are always looking for opportunities to grow and learn from one another.

In your daily life at Planning Center, you could expect to:

  • Take ownership of your projects and have a voice in how to best complete them
  • Collaborate on Github with your product manager, front-end designer, and fellow app team developers
  • Engage in an agile development process (and, depending on your team, get to call your sprints “fun runs”)
  • Make coffee eight different ways in our rad coffee bar
  • ...or, if you’re remote, drink coffee in a hip coworking space that we help pay for
  • Do work you’re proud of alongside a team of smart, thoughtful, like-minded developers

We believe the strongest teams are made up of people with diverse backgrounds and experiences, and we are committed to cultivating that diversity here at Planning Center. We are ready for the ongoing work that goes into building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do your best work.

Requirements

  1. Experience with Ruby on Rails and JavaScript.
  2. If remote, must be willing to travel to the office four times each year to connect in person with the rest of the team.

Benefits

We love our people and want this to be the best place for them to work. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer:

  • Full health, dental, and vision coverage
  • Company contribution to a 401(k)
  • Mobile phone allowance
  • Co-working stipend
  • Charitable giving match
  • Paid parental leave
  • Vacation and paid holidays
  • Paid Fridays off in the summer
  • Continual education allowance for books, videos, or conferences
  • Free weeks every several months to work on a project of your choosing

items.title: Web Application Developer
items.content:
Web Application Developer



Alternate Job Title: Web Developer



Work Location: Telecommute/Remote, but must reside local to Phoenix metro area.



Help support some of the most visible web sites in the world!



Job Description



OMNITEC Solutions, Inc., ( http://www.omnitecinc.com ) provides a variety of robust web solutions to the federal government and the Department of Defense. 



We're looking for someone passionate about web development, specifically using ASP.NET, C#, and SQL, while also skilled in client-side development, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap.



Quick Note #1: this position requires US citizenship and an active Secret clearance or the ability to immediately obtain an Interim Secret. If you are a US citizen and clearable, this is a great opportunity to be sponsored for your clearance!



Quick Note #2: We can ONLY consider candidates currently living in the Phoenix, AZ metro area who can telecommute and make regular team meetings held in the Phoenix, AZ area (85382). 



You will be part of a dynamic team providing application development for some of the most visible web sites in the world, including:



http://www.af.mil;
http://www.navy.mil;
http://www.defense.gov;
http://www.marines.mil, and
http://www.usace.army.mil/.



Duties and Responsibilities



OMNITEC Solutions has supported this client for 12+ years. This is a long-term contract with substantial opportunity for growth and stability. The scope of this contract is an end-to-end, or "turn-key" solution, meaning all Development and Infrastructure support is provided and managed by OMNITEC Solutions.



This provides our Developers, System Engineers & Administrators, and Technical Support professionals a level of flexibility, impact, career development not available when these services are separated by different contractors.



Required Skills




  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related degree. A passion for cutting-edge technology;

  • 3+ years of professional software development experience;

  • Strong communications skills;

  • Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, etc;

  • Proficiency in ASP.NET using C# and Microsoft SQL server;

  • US citizenship and either an active Secret clearance or the ability to immediately obtain an Interim Secret.



Helpful Skills




  • Sharp analytical abilities;

  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies, coding standards, source control management, build processes, and testing;

  • Experience building web applications, widgets, or other interactive experiences;

  • Experience with CSS, HTML5, JSON, AJAX, jQuery, and Bootstrap;

  • Experience using a Content Management System;

  • Experience with DotNetNuke;

  • Experience with Git/Github.

  • CompTIA Security+.



Please apply directly via this job posting or visit "Careers" on our web site: http://www.omnitecinc.com



OMNITEC Solutions, Inc., is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, disability, gender, gender identity, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.title: Interstate Capital Corporation: Ruby on Rails Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Ruby on Rails Developer

 

 

 

 

Interstate Capital is seeking an experienced Ruby on Rails Developer. This is a demanding role in which you will be responsible for building new applications and maintaining existing systems used by the company on a daily basis. You will be reporting directly to the CIO/CMO.  You will also be liaising with internal stakeholders as well as external resources to ensure that all development tasks are carried through on-time and per specifications. The successful candidate needs to be flexible, dedicated, and committed to the success of the application requirements set by the company.

 

 

 

Main Responsibilities

 

 

 

  • Developing new Ruby on Rails applications using Rails 5.x.

  • Maintaining existing Ruby on Rails applications using Rails 1.x, 2.x, and 4.x.

  • Upgrading existing Ruby on Rails applications that use older versions of Rails to 5.x.

  • Communicating with the Interstate Capital team and providing technical support of all applications, including fixing bugs, reviewing log files, and answering questions related to application functionality.

  • Scoping, documenting, wireframing, and integrating new feature requests.

  • Writing well tested, maintainable code.

  • Integrating applications with third-party APIs.

  • Documenting new application functionality.

  • Managing the deployment pipeline and hosting platform, and making sure the hosting platform is stable.

     

 

Knowledge & Skills

 

 

 

  • Project Management
  • Ruby on Rails
  • MySQL

  • Git

Compensation

items.title: Full Time: Senior Software Engineer for Digital Health Startup at BrainCheck in Houston, TX (remote considered)
items.content:
Company & position overview
BrainCheck is an innovative cognitive health technology company co-founded by neuroscientists Dr. David Eagleman and Dr. Yael Katz. The company recently completed its post-seed fundraising and has market traction with schools and athletic teams, physicians offices, and hospitals. The startup team is operating out of Texas Medical Center’s Innovation Center (TMCX+) in Houston.

As we scale our user-adoption and build out exciting new features in the application, we are looking for an experienced engineer to join the team and help drive product innovation. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver who can respond quickly to changing business needs. If this sounds like you and you’re excited to solve big challenges at the cutting edge of healthcare, then reach out and let’s talk.

Key responsibilities:
*Feature development and maintenance for codebases in Ruby on Rails, Unity, and Ember.
*Maintenance of the automated testing and deployment systems (Jenkins and Travis).
*BrainCheck app deployment and management on AWS.
*Integrating partner apps, such as health monitoring and EMR platforms, with BrainCheck systems.
*Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment a must

Required skills include:
*5+ years of experience working as a software developer
*Working knowledge of modern front-end development and javascript proficiency
*Test driven development procedures and tools
*Familiarity with Unity3D and/or Rails a big plus
*Use of AWS technologies, including EC2, CodeDeploy, and S3, a plus
*Experience building, deploying, and maintaining iOS and Android apps a plus

Working at BrainCheck:
*Join a vibrant team, collaborating to pioneer cognitive health
*Early-stage startup with significant upside potential
*Headquartered at TMCX+ – home to dozens of the most innovative startups and innovation labs in the healthcare industry
*We work hard but like to have fun, including happy-hours, ping-pong and other games
*Competitive compensation consisting of cash and equity

More about the Company
BrainCheck takes gold-standard neurocognitive tests and turns them into mobile interactive games, providing a snapshot of an individual’s cognitive health in about 10 minutes. Our current market offering, BrainCheck Sport, assesses cognitive deficits associated with concussion in sports and athletics, and we also have a direct to consumer version available for iPad and iPhone. Our newly released BrainCheck Memory assesses cognitive and memory impairment associated with dementia, and we are developing a generalized cognitive health tracking tool for the healthy population. BrainCheck has reinvented the process of cognitive assessment to be faster, less expensive, and as reliable as conventional methods.

BrainCheck was developed at the Eagleman Neuroscience Laboratory at Baylor College of Medicine. Dr. David Eagleman has done groundbreaking work on neurocognitive assessment, and he is also a public educator, authoring New York Times bestselling books and appearing regularly on television (most recently PBS’s series The Brain with David Eagleman). David is joined by CEO, Dr. Yael Katz, neuroscientist and technology executive, and a team of ten outstanding individuals in product, software development, clinical research, marketing, business development, and sales.

No agencies / recruiters, please

items.title: Fullstack Developer
items.content:
OUR COMPANY

We have a vision to empower all businesses to compete on a global scale. Basically (although it’s not basic at all), we are redefining how people and businesses establish trust across the digital economy. Our first step is removing friction from transactions across the regulated economy by changing how compliance policies are built & managed.

We’re a young and ambitious start-up aiming to dominate the RegTech category estimated to be worth $118.7bn by 2020. We’re early on our journey – you’ll join our team of 10! We have customers, are revenue generating, are based in the centre of London and have raised over £1.4m in Seed funding from London’s top early stage investors. We’re looking for outstanding people to help us shape the future of RegTech.

We have developed a Smart Policy platform to enable regulated businesses to build & manage compliance policies programmatically. Our approach enables the automation and digitisation of tasks & actions previously performed by human compliance professionals. Every Smart Policy managed using PassFort benefits from our purpose-built case management application & third party integration marketplace ensuring that customer compliance profiles can be verified in real-time & evolve with changing requirements.

We are building the infrastructure required to link the human concept of trust with the transformative technology of the internet. Doing so will enable every business (not just e-commerce businesses) to build customer relationships & transact online. The impacts for global economic development will be profound.

THE ROLE

We’re seeking a fantastic full stack engineer to help change the face of customer onboarding. You’ll join the current (awesome) product team of 6.

Day to day you’ll be thinking about everything from architecture, security and performance, all the way through to feature UX. You’ll have ownership and responsibility right across the product. PassFort has a culture of quality engineering, and we like to keep on top of tech debt. Building things right will be important to you.

We work in an agile fashion, with daily stand-ups and bi-weekly retrospectives. You’ll bring new ideas, and become an integral part of the process to continuously improve our product, along with our working practices.

Our stack includes ES6, React, Redux on the front-end, and Python (with a sprinkling of Rust) on the back-end. We have a service based architecture built on top of Kubernetes and Google’s Cloud Platform.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own the implementation of entire features, including technical design, implementation and release.
Comfortable working across the codebase, learning new technologies and skills as the business requires.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior members of the team.
Craft maintainable and testable code.

SKILLS

A deep knowledge of either Python or Javascript, and at least a working knowledge of the other.
Experience with Rust (or another compiled language) would also be great.
Experience with React/Redux (or other SPA frameworks) a plus.
Experience in DevOps (particularly Kubernetes) a plus.

BENEFITS

PassFort is an amazing business to work in with a super exciting and executable vision. Our team members are rewarded well, not only from a salary perspective (££ DOE for this role) but also with:

A homely environment in our Grade II listed offices in central London,
An annual learning & development budget to spend on what you want,
A monthly wellness budget (not restricted to gyms – go for a spa day or rock-climbing if you like),
‘Decide your own holiday’ entitlement,
Pension contributions (investing in your future is important!),
Pick your own equipment and kit, and not to forget,
…Equity!

items.title: IOS Android Mobile Developer
items.content:
Job Description
We are looking for a junior to mid-level native mobile developer to join our fully remote development team. You will be working with our engineers to develop and maintain our high quality mobile application.

items.title: Technical Lead
items.content:
At Passfort, we have a vision to empower all businesses to compete on a global scale. Basically (although it’s not basic at all), we are redefining how people and businesses establish trust across the digital economy. Our first step is removing friction from transactions across the regulated economy by changing how compliance policies are built & managed.

We’re a young and ambitious start-up aiming to dominate the RegTech category estimated to be worth $118.7bn by 2020. We’re early on our journey – you’ll join our team of 10! We have customers, are revenue generating, are based in the centre of London and have raised over £1.4m in Seed funding from London’s top early stage investors. We’re looking for outstanding people to help us shape the future of RegTech.

We have developed a Smart Policy platform to enable regulated businesses to build & manage compliance policies programmatically. Our approach enables the automation and digitisation of tasks & actions previously performed by human compliance professionals. Every Smart Policy managed using PassFort benefits from our purpose-built case management application & third party integration marketplace ensuring that customer compliance profiles can be verified in real-time & evolve with changing requirements.

We are building the infrastructure required to link the human concept of trust with the transformative technology of the internet. Doing so will enable every business (not just e-commerce businesses) to build customer relationships & transact online. The impacts for global economic development will be profound.

*THE ROLE*

We’re seeking a fantastic Technical Lead to help change the face of customer onboarding.

You will work with the current (awesome) team of 4 engineers that manage and optimise ongoing operations of infrastructure, and delivers new features.

First and foremost, you’ll be a technical expert. You’ll be hands on with code and a contributor in the team, thinking about everything from architecture, security and performance, all the way through to feature UX. We’re looking for someone to bring new ideas, and become an integral part of the process to continuously improve our product.

You’ll work with our CTO to shape and manage priorities and delivery on the product roadmap. As we grow (and we’re growing rapidly), you’ll bring your experience in growing and developing a high functioning team at scale. You’ll understand technical needs, anticipate any issues, and ensure plans are developed, communicated and responsibilities agreed within the team. You’ll have a knack for translating technical ideas into simple and effective plans, and developing a framework for driving their execution in line with business needs.

You’ll help embed engineering best practice and delivery standards, and evolve the technical expertise of the team through coaching. We’re invested in building a collaborative culture that gives back to the community, where we work together to help catalyse innovation and development. You’ll also be integral to supporting the process of recruitment and onboarding new members into the team.

This is an incredible opportunity to take ownership of a new and developing role in a rapidly growing startup.

Our stack includes ES6, React, Redux on the front-end, and Python (with a sprinkling of Rust) on the back-end. We have a service based architecture built on top of Kubernetes and Google’s Cloud Platform.

*REQUIREMENTS*

* A track record of leading and growing an effective technology team, and establishing best practice and delivery standards
* Ability to translate technical ideas into simple and effective plans, putting delivery frameworks in place
* Commercial mindset, able to contribute to the development of tech and product
strategies in line with the business goals
* Ability to support the CTO in prioritising and managing deliveries on the product roadmap
* Confident communicator
* Flexibility to adapt with a growing business and culture
* A deep knowledge of either Python or Javascript, and at least a working knowledge of
the other.
* Experience with React a plus.
* Experience with Rust would also be great.
* Experience in DevOps (particularly Kubernetes) a plus.

*BENEFITS*

* A homely environment in our Grade II listed offices in central London,
* An annual learning & development budget to spend on what you want,
* A monthly wellness budget (not restricted to gyms – go for a spa day or rock-climbing if you like),
* ‘Decide your own holiday’ entitlement,
* Pension contributions (investing in your future is important!),
* Pick your own equipment and kit, and not to forget,
* …Equity!

items.title: Chomp: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer

Posted Dec 7

Chomp
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA

We are currently developing an exciting new camera app called Chomp. This app allows you to capture mouthwatering dining experiences and share them with friends. 

In the United States, there are 53M people who take pictures of their meal while dining in restaurants, however, 60% of these users do not post their pictures on social media. 80% of Snapchat users use the app in restaurants, however, most people don't tend to post their pictures on social media because they prefer to share their dining experiences privately with friends. For this reason, there is a need for an app that allows users to privately share their experiences.

It is our aim to make Chomp the most widely used camera app for dining experiences not only in the U.S but also all over the world. 


JOB DESCRIPTION
We are looking for a talented individual who can help us to shape our product and culture from a long-term perspective.

As a core member in the initial stages, you will be working alongside us to develop our product from the current prototype stage until it is ready for launch, as well as, be involved in future stages of product growth.

Although our tech stack is evolving rapidly, however, we are building the front-end with React Native + GraphQL and the backend with Ruby on Rails. Experience with any of those technologies is a plus, however, we're also open to speaking with talented engineers who can pick up things quickly.


RESPONSIBILITIES 
- Be involved in every aspect of the development process (ideation to launch) 
- As a team player, you will need to frequently communicate and cooperate with various teams to ensure that all stages run smoothly until the product is launched. 
- Work with frontend and backend projects to build a high-quality, maintainable, and well-tested code. 
- Delegate tasks to team members when necessary and consult with other team members when uncertain. 
- Keep an interest in the latest technology/information to increase the team’s curiosity.


REQUIREMENTS 
- 5+ years’ experience in iOS or JavaScript development 
- Strong working knowledge of Test driven development 
- Basic understanding of React or React Native with a strong desire to learn (experience not necessary) 
- Experience with full-stack development


DESIRED SKILLS 
- Skillful at writing reusable, quality codes 
- Familiar with several of our stacks, including: Ruby, Ruby on Rails, node.js, React, React Native, GraphQL, MySQL, JavaScript, AWS, Docker (preferred but not necessary) 
- Experience with consumer mobile applications 
- Experience developing high quality software products within an engineering team 
- Startup experience or experience working in small teams


WHO WE ARE 
- 7 foodies who are creating a mobile app that we can use with our friends and family 
- We are currently a small team consisting of a CEO, 5 engineers, and a designer. 
- A remote friendly team with employees located in London, Tokyo and San Francisco where our headquarters is located. 
- Successful entrepreneurs and engineers who have built large scale systems from scratch. 
- Raised $2.5M in funding from some of Asia’s top investors.


BENEFITS & PERKS 
- Competitive salary / Stock options package 
- PTO: 15 days vacation plus national holidays 
- Flexible working hours and locations 
- Reimbursement of costs incurred from usage of co-working space 
- Business trip opportunities to America (1-3 times yearly)

Apply for this position

https://chomp.workable.com/jobs/620432

items.content:
EY (Ernst&Young) GigNow | Front End Developer | Palo Alto, CA | Partial Remote/In office | 6 Month Contract

GigNow is an online portal that matches contract talent with relevant opportunities at EY. Our platform allows you to directly access contract opportunities at EY and find an assignment that gives you the professional growth and flexibility you desire.

GigNow comes with a dedicated recruiting team. Applications get reviewed by our recruiting team and you can easily track your application status on the site.

There are four openings for Front End Developers to work on the GigNow Platform itself which acts as an Applicant Tracking System and Web Portal. The team is small and is looking for developers focusing in front end for at least 3 years and 1 year utilizing React.js

This would be a partial remote position and in office work located in Palo Alto, CA. Local candidates only at this time.

Initial duration is 6 months but could go longer as the team

items.title: codelathe: Full Stack Software Engineer
items.content:
Full Stack Software Engineer

Posted Dec 6

codelathe
Headquarters: Austin, TX
https://www.getfilecloud.com/jobs/

About CodeLathe

At CodeLathe, we are building the world’s most powerful unified file services platform that organizes enterprise data, enhances collaboration and productivity while providing ironclad data protection. Our product FileCloud is quickly becoming the standard in Enterprise File Services space and it is widely used by Global 2000, Fortune 500 and world leading organizations in city, state and federal governments. We are based out of Austin, Texas, USA and looking for talented people anywhere in the globe. 

Our Vision

Organize enterprise information and make it universally accessible!

Top Ten Reasons to Join Us

  1. Work with a world class engineering team that is out to change the world
  2. Fast growing company with lots of growth opportunities
  3. Strong engineering and product focused culture
  4. 100% Remote Job – Work comfortably from your home office and avoid the commute
  5. Unique, customer driven software development process
  6. Work on the most challenging technical problems – File Systems, Search, AI, Distributed Systems.
  7. Work on widely used cutting edge tech stack
  8. Gender diversity – Men (60%), Women (40%)
  9. Part of a huge 10+ Billion $ and growing market space
  10. Competitive compensation based on experience and location

Responsibilities

  • Create elegant, efficient and maintainable software to support and extend our current software products
  • Solve complex architectural challenges when implementing new features
  • Integrate with databases, file systems, cloud services when delivering solutions
  • Troubleshoot and fix reported customer issues, delivering software patches as needed

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or in related discipline with 4 or more years of professional software engineering experience, at least 3 years experience in web app development
  • Strong knowledge of web technologies including HTTP protocol, XML, REST is required
  • Strong knowledge of Object Oriented programming, design patterns etc is required
  • Strong knowledge of client server architecture is required
  • 4+ years in PHP development is required
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 is required
  • Familiarity with SQL/NoSQL databases like MongoDB and their declarative query languages is a plus
  • Self starter, highly motivated and works with little or no supervision
  • Passionate in software development, takes ownership and pride in their job


Location: Remote.  Compensation is based on experience and location. 

Apply for this position

Send a resume to jobs@codelathe.com. Please refer Job ID: FSE4 as a subject line.

items.title: CareerBliss (https://www.careerbliss.com) | Irvine, CA | Full-time, REMOTE
items.content:
CareerBliss (https://www.careerbliss.com) | Irvine, CA | Full-time, REMOTE

CareerBliss is a resource and community for job seekers. We provide users with career research, company reviews, job postings and email alerts.

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join our engineering team. We have a fun and fast-paced environment that focuses on rapid innovation. Our project infrastructure includes a C# MVC website, SQL Server 2008 R2 database, Solr and MongoDB search and analytics, and Golang based email engines.

If you have a passion for development, want to work with variety of technologies and grow in your career, this is the position for you.

The ideal candidate for this position will have the following required skills:

  * 2-3 years of experience with C# ASP.NET MVC  * 2-3 years of experience with SQL Server 2008 or newer  * 2 years of experience with Bootstrap and JavaScript
If you have any of the following preferred skills, please also apply:

  * Any experience with AngularJS or ReactJS  * Any experience with Solr or Elasticsearch
Come join a growing company with a great corporate culture and a passion for innovation. We are looking for someone who enjoys the startup atmosphere and is willing to rise to the occasion on new challenges.

This is a remote position. If you'd like to apply, please send your resume and a note about what makes you interested to nadeem.chaudhry {at} careerbliss.com

items.title: YC Company Seeks Scrappy Tech Startup Sales Hustler
items.content:
YC Company Seeks Scrappy Tech Startup Sales Hustler at HigherMe

Boston, Toronto, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$40K–$90K
0.1%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Are you looking to disrupt a stagnant industry with some cool technology?  Want to work with some A-players who have real experience building a multi-million dollar business?  Are you a crazy hard worker with a passion for the startup lifestyle?  We’d love to tell you more about HigherMe – our recruiting platform is going to revolutionize the way retail and service employers find and hire their employees.

We’re looking for a scrappy sales hustler that wants to work for a fun, agile startup disrupting an old and boring industry.

What we do

HigherMe helps retail & hourly employers find better employees faster. Using matching algorithms and video, our recruitment platform helps managers find, screen, and hire employees. Applicants record a 30-second video pitch to showcase their personality, and our analytics help screen the best candidates.

This role will involve:

- Calling prospective small business owners
- Selling our candidate finding & screening solution - helping their hiring managers save time, and finding better employment candidates
- Following up with customers and keeping them engaged in the process

We're looking for

- A super-crazy extroverted person who is right at home cold-calling 100 companies in a day and hearing "No" 80% of the time
- Someone who can work long, insane hours as we begin to scale up our company and prepare to raise money
- Someone with a bachelor's degree from a decent school, most likely in business or marketing - but we're open
- Someone with 1-2 years experience, or fresh out of school - but we'll consider talking to more experienced folks, too

Contact for more info: rob@higherme.com

items.title: Senior Software Engineer, Core & Data
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer, Core & Data at Simon Data

New York City, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Python, Data Visualization, Hadoop, Machine Learning, SQL, Amazon Web Services, Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift, Data Engineering
Compensation
$95K–$175K
0.1%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Successful engineering teams are built on trust and purpose. At Simon Data we take that literally. We take pride in what we do every day and how we do it. Providing great software to our customers is rewarding and energizing. We've found a rapidly expanding sweet spot in marketing software and are diversifying our engineering team to keep up with the demand.

New engineers are welcomed into a team of smart and passionate engineers who love data and writing pragmatic code. We believe that you code better when you know how your work connects to the product and our clients. We also believe that you code better when you're surrounded by other engineers who want you to succeed. This attitude is core to our values.

As a Core & Data Software Engineer, you'll be exposed to the core of our software and the data it keeps. From your first day on the job, you'll have the opportunity to:

- Interface with data from dozens of clients, each of which have upwards of a terabyte of data (SQL technologies).
- Own the build out our data pipe, aggregating data from both structured and unstructured sources (Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, EMR, Redshift).
- Scale and optimize our client facing data warehouse that provides real-time interactivity across millions of rows of data (Redshift, Elasticsearch).
- Lead development of statistical models and predictive technology to improve our experimentation and segmentation tooling (Machine learning, D3).
- Develop critical features to in our python software stack.
- Collaborate with an engineering team who is passionate about quality, staying ahead of the curve, and teamwork.

Our clients rely on us for accurate data and availability. Making mistakes in our business has direct effects on our clients' customers. We take both of these facts very seriously. At odds with this, Simon embraces the startup ethos of keeping lean and focused. We move quickly (continuous deployment) and emphasize experimentation to test hypotheses. To help us keep a high bar of quality, you'll bring a mindset for creativity and fault tolerance to your work every day.

Simon's engineering team is distributed across four states; we welcome engineers working at our New York City offices as well as remote employees.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

We'd love to meet you and learn more about your career goals.
