Description

Company Overview

ActiveProspect is a marketing Software as a Service (Saas) platform that instantly qualifies internet leads. We help marketers automate their unique processes for acquiring qualified sales leads, building accurate email subscriber lists, and providing superior transparency for legal compliance. Each month, millions of opt-in Internet leads are processed on the ActiveProspect platform on behalf of customers across a wide range of industries. As lead generation innovators, we invented the concept of lead certification to help marketers independently verify the origin and authenticity of Internet leads. Founded in 2004, ActiveProspect is headquartered in Austin, TX.

Job Summary

ActiveProspect is a marketing Softwares as a Service platform for lead acquisition success.

As a Senior Front End JavaScript Developer, will play a vital role in the design and development of our flagship product, LeadConduit. Your focus will be on application interface implementation. You must have worked within the complexities of a software environment.. You notice every tiny detail without losing the big picture and are constantly critiquing and analyzing every web experience.

We are a small team of effective developers committed to the potential of our software offerings and the company in general. Each developer has a stake in the direction of our products, the company, and the culture surrounding those things.

The product is currently built on Angular 1.x, but we are are process of reviewing other technologies. This position will definitely have a voice in determining what technology will best suit our needs for the upcoming years.

To succeed in this role you'll need:

  • Experience shipping and maintaining SaaS, browser-based applications
  • Strong JavaScript knowledge and experience with one or more application frameworks (Angular, React, Backbone.js, or others)
  • Expert knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Familiarity with responsive design and implementation
  • The moxie to stand up for what you believe
  • Direct participation in the decision making process
  • The ability to communicate about user experience with technical and non-technical colleagues
  • Experience iterating on designs from release to release to make them the best they can be

Bonus point for:

  • Experience working with charting libraries like Highcharts and D3
  • Experience working with Node.js
  • Experience working in a fast development environment
  • Familiarity with version control & Git

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Austin or Remote

items.title: Senior/Lead Fullstack/Frontend engineer
items.content:
Ever thought about leading a bunch of extremely talented engineers working on engaging and beautiful applications on mobile and desktop platforms? How about branching out to VR and AR? Do you like to work in a fast-paced environment with a fantastic product team? Do you feel like your current job is just a job and you have to fight for flexible hours, ability to work from home, and your innovation time is reduced to an occasional hackathon? Are you tired of various business stakeholders treating you like a waiter in a fast-food restaurant? If the answer is yes, then read on and hit that 'Apply Now' button, because we are different!

At Concrete we work hard to create a perfect environment for our engineers. We don't have a Michelin star chef to serve your lunch but we do have an established working from home policy so you can spend more time with your family. We also don't have a barista on-site to serve your almond milk latte, but we are flexible - you can start your day in the office at any time providing you make it for our daily standup (because it is important! and yes, we do have a very good coffee machine).

This time we are looking for a Senior Fullstack engineer to take ownership and guide our multi-skilled development team. You will be working alongside management and the backend lead to deliver applications for a new retail platform using the very latest JavaScript technologies and Frameworks.

We are constantly building new applications for our clients - Marks and Spencer, GAP and many more. Working on a real-time collaboration software is challenging - you will have to learn new technologies and prototype new apps at a speed of light, but not because it is a high-pressure environment, simply because you like to see your code working in production. That said, we don't tolerate sloppy coding - for every single line of code we write, there is almost always a line of unit-testing code.

If you're a frontend lead right now or a driven senior engineer with a burning desire for a career progression and a skillset to match - get in touch!

Skills & Requirements

Must have
* Strong experience developing web apps and mobile-first websites
* 5+ years experience in development using modern stacks / frameworks / technologies
* An expert understanding of Javascript (ES6)
* Experience with OO and MVC design patterns
* Understanding of functional programming
* Solid experience with React/Redux/Redux-saga
* Solid experience with Node.js
* Knowledge of when and how to apply design patterns
* Good grasp of functional programming and SOLID principles
* TDD/Unit testing
* Clean code is your second nature
* Experience with testing frameworks such as jest, mocha, chai etc...
* Experience developing SaaS products
* Previous experience of managing, mentoring and coaching teams of engineers
* Worked previously in an international environment
* Links to existing work or projects on Git
* Experience with AWS

Nice to have
* Other programming languages (Go, Rust)
* Experience designing APIs from scratch
* Kubernetes/Docker
* Exposure to event-sourcing architecture
* Experience with CQRS

items.title: Front End Developer 100
items.content:
Job description



This is a 100% fulltime remote work for independent contractors only. Please do not apply for your company or agency services.


We prefer to hire a developer to join our company who has 100% experience in FRONT END development work, not back end.  You must be from Europe and Asia to be able to collaborate best with our current dev team is in Asia or Europe. And so it is unlikely (although not impossible) that we will hire in north or south america.


You will be working from home with mostly flexible hours although you will need to attend the team meeting which is at approximately 8:30am GMT and to work for 3 hours after this time for team collaboration (This is 3:30am to 6:30am New York time, so you can see that’s the reason we are not likely to hire in north, central or south america).


WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR


You will be working in a team of around 10 other developers. You will be working on complex bugs, new features, and improvements for the software. The software is the web app of our time tracking software for remote teams.


You are going to get involved into different branching models for version control, and strict coding standards, work with continuous integration.


TO BE A BEST FIT FOR THIS JOB YOU NEED TO:



  • be an expert in HTML5 and Javascript. Expert means that you have solid knowledge of the language and the environment

  • have good experience in React.js (2+ years), building web based applications

  • have a solid experience in front-end optimization and performance improvements

  • have good experience in integration of external REST services with React.js

  • be an expert in slicing PSD to HTML

  • have a good understanding of CSS and Sass

  • Be an expert in twitter bootstrap

  • have a good experience with Angular JS is a plus

  • be able to solve complex bugs quickly

  • know how to document your code

  • want to learn and work with technologies and frameworks

  • have experience with with git is a must


NOTE: You must agree to use our time tracking software while at work. This will be the basis for your payment.


APPLICATION PROCESS:


TO APPLY, please go to this link https://timedoctor.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0fz3p and submit all the requirements mentioned in the job posting, if you want to be considered for the job.

Web Front & Back-End Engineer at MapLarge

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Compensation: $100,000
Openings: 3


Do you do your own dishes? We've got a job for you (and it's not dishwashing ;-) ).


Do you put them in the sink and expect someone else to do them? Move on, please.


Do you get pissed (in a professional way) when someone else leaves their dishes in the sink?  Please apply!


TrainerRoad is looking to expand our engineering group. We're looking for smart software engineers who "get things done". We’re interested in remote candidates in the USA or candidates interested in working in our Reno office.


Areas of work include Xamarin iOS/OSX/Android, WPF, ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Core, Web API, HTML/Javascript, Angular2, Azure, DocumentDB, ANT sport devices, Bluetooth Smart sport devices, Build/Test integration, and SQL among others.


We're looking to hire three engineers to expand our web team. Inside of that team people usually focus on one of the following areas:


Backend Development - Controllers, API, Services, Azure data stuff, Integrations, etc


Frontend Development - Angular2, API, Controllers


TrainerRoad handles a large amount of data and our site gets a lot of use by a set of passionate users. On the backend, you might enqueue millions of items to process via Azure Functions or WebJobs (quickly and efficiently).  On the frontend, you'll be writing code that handles multiple requests per second.


What I'm saying is your code will matter.


We've also got a crack design team. They make it so engineers never have to write a single line of CSS!


Note: We're not on ASP.NET Core yet but we'll move there as soon as EF catches up with our requirements.


Who We're Looking For


We want smart engineers! The ideal candidate is a "developer's developer" and enjoys reading about programming in their free time, tinkering on the weekends with side projects and staying abreast of the latest frameworks/technologies in their area of expertise.


We basically want someone with a passion for development.


Required Technology Experience



  • C# Experience - Intermediate to Advanced proficiency


Optional Technology Experience



  • ASP.net MVC

  • ASP.net Core

  • Javascript Frameworks (Angular2, React, etc)

  • LINQ

  • Web API

  • Azure

  • DocumentDB

  • SQL

  • HTML

  • Build/Test CI (We use TeamCity)


Work Remote or in Reno, Nevada


We're looking for the best candidate we can find in the US. Over half of our development team works remotely. It works very well with the help of Slack and Github.


We expect remote employees to overlap at least 6 hours with the Reno, Nevada office (we're there 8am-5pm Pacific time).


Salary


We're looking to hire engineers for 100k/year.  If you ask for more we'll reject your application. If you're interested in the company please subscribe to our RSS feed at jobs.trainerroad.com for when a higher level job posting is open.


Perks



  • Unlimited Vacation

  • 401k with 4% company matching 

  • 99% of employees individual health care paid (I know 99% is weird...it's an ACA thing and it ends up being just a few dollars per paycheck)

  • Flexible schedule

  • Access to the latest fitness devices (power meters, trainers, sensors, etc.)


Your Resume should have...



  • Links to any open source projects you've contributed to

  • Github/StackOverflow username if you'd like

  • Examples of experience in the "Optional Technology Experience" area


Your Cover Letter should have...



  • Let us know why you want to work for TrainerRoad


We also Require...


The best engineers only want to work with other great engineers. We've found that the best way to find great engineers is to actually have them code, not just answer trivia questions during an interview.


That's why we require applications to do a refactoring exercise as part of their job submission. The right candidate won't find this a pain in the ass; it should be enjoyable.


This also weeds out the vast majority of candidates who just fire off resumes everywhere.


You can download the refactoring exercise here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/95pt8m84znr1jf7/bike-distributor-refactor.zip?dl=0


It has a readme.txt in it with instructions.


Excited about our Company?


In your application let us know why you want to work with us and why you think you'd be a good fit for our company.


FAQs


Do I have to be a cyclist to apply?


Nope! Not everyone in the company is a cyclist. It helps if you're an active racer but it's not required. If you are a racer or TrainerRoad user let us know!


What's unlimited vacation mean?


The CEO of TrainerRoad used to be an engineer at a Fortune 500 company where life was a grind. We believe employees put out their best work when they are happy and not burnt out.


If your brain just isn't working at 3 pm, we encourage employees to go home and rest up. It does no one any good to sit and stare at the computer screen for another two hours. We don't track that time.


Employees generally shoot for around four weeks of REAL vacation time (no slack checking) but some take more and some take less.  The thing we care about is how productive you can be and how much value you can add to the company. Bottom line, we want people who are passionate and get things done. If you meet those requirements everything else works itself out.


That being said, if you end up taking massive amounts of vacation, come in late, leave early and aren't producing outstanding work we're going to have a problem.


How do you work?


We're big believers in Deep Work and Flow. If you're not turning off Slack (snooze), going DND on your phone and shutting off the world for multiple hours a day you're probably not being as productive as you could be. The idea is a developer should be able to work on a chunk of work that they understand totally distraction free for multiple hours.  This is the only way the company moves forward.


We try to work as pragmatically as we can.  We have excellent designers on staff who go from mockups to responsive HTML with light javascript work.


Development uses Github with a strict pull request process. We test, comment, refactor and improve each other's pull requests.


We have partial test coverage and we're constantly improving in that area.


We have a QA team (we call them the Test Team) that checks every PR and does full regression checks for each release.


We have an Automation Team that only focuses on writing UI tests to speed up testing and find bugs faster.


We can one-click deploy our app on Alpha, Beta, and Production channels.


We can one-click deploy our website to Azure (includes smoke tests and warm up).


We have nightly builds that deploy to Test Flight and Google Play.


We often pair program via Screen Hero.


We work off bi-weekly sprint issue lists on Github.


Developers get the super fast machines and awesome equipment. If it's going to let you be more productive we want to spend the money on it.


You didn't ask about education, what's required?


Please put your education on your resume, but we're not going to reject someone because they don't have a degree in Computer Science. We understand that some of the best and most passionate engineers are self-taught.


How long until I hear a response from you guys? What's the process?


If you don't follow directions in this job posting you'll be immediately rejected.  


If you did follow directions our goal is to review your refactoring within a week of submitting your application. All refactoring reviews are done "blind"; meaning the reviewer doesn't know your name, resume or where you're from.  Code is code and it should be reviewed that way without bias.


If we like you're refactoring we'll have you do a coding logic quiz.  Nothing super deep CS wise.  We've found that the candidates who do the best on these exercises are very successful at TrainerRoad.


We'll take the top combined refactoring and coding quiz results and set you up for a team interview.


If the team likes you; we'll then set up a pair programming session with you and our CTO.  We'll give you a tour of our codebase and work on a real issue. This gives you a chance to run away from our codebase screaming and also demonstrate that you can communicate with us.


If all of the above is good, you're hired!  


I know this sounds like a lot of hoops to jump through but it works so so well!  Once you're onboard you'll love that everyone else went through the same process and is up to "your level" in terms of "get-shit-doneness".


What's with the dishes analogy?


Doing your own dishes is a GREAT analogy for our culture.  Don't leave shit around for someone else to clean up.  Do your own dishes.  Do you see someone making a mess? Let's discuss it (in a productive manner) so that we can nip that behavior in the bud.


We know we're really doing well when someone points out a manager not "doing their dishes" or causing an extra headache for a process that doesn't add value (it happens). Seriously, we need employees to call managers out on this.  I'm the CEO writing this; please oh please tell me if I'm messing up or not walking the talk.


This is the longest job posting ever, when does it end?


Right now! Congrats if you made it this far! We look forward to looking at your resume and refactoring exercise.

items.title: Mobile Engineer @ Retail Zipline
items.content:
Mobile Engineer @ Retail Zipline

2017-11-24 20:54

Description

“Terrific founders with technical and domain expertise, totally focused on customer success. Their progress in the first year is amazing.” - One of our investors

Retailers use archaic, old systems that don't work (think fax machines and voicemails). We're replacing the core operational processes with a modern platform that our customers love. Help us transform a $4.4 trillion industry and improve the way millions of people work. Major retailers are already using Zipline every day, but there is so much more to do!

“I think I just shed a tear. This is great!” – One of our Fortune 100 customers

We're looking for you, our first mobile developer. There is a lot of opportunity to set a solid foundation for our mobile app and we want to bring on the right person to make that happen. You will be working closely with our design team and our engineering team to deliver a set of high quality mobile apps. We'll help you build a team as necessary to make sure you can deliver on the goals we set together.

You get to start with a mostly clean slate. Deep understanding of at least one mobile framework is a must, and previous experience with Ruby on Rails would be a nice addition so that we can move quickly. We currently only have a simple iOS app in the app store and are actively deciding on the best way to deliver great mobile apps. You will be central to those conversations and influence the direction that we take.

You will help define our culture through hiring decisions, process design, and your personality. You don't need to have experience with management. But, a desire to help your co-workers grow makes a world of difference.

Responsibilities

  • Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support)
  • Produce fully functional mobile applications writing clean code
  • Gather specific requirements and suggest solutions
  • Write unit and UI tests to identify malfunctions
  • Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance
  • Stay up-to-date with new technology trends

Requirements

  • A preference for getting things done
  • Proven work experience as a Mobile developer
  • Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market
  • In-depth knowledge of at least one programming language like Swift and Java
  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs
  • Familiarity with OOP design principles
  • Excellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude
  • Ability to perform in a team environment
  • Ability to write well tested applications

Benefits

We're a fully remote company, building a product that makes money and that people love. You can live wherever you'd like as long as you can be employed by a Canadian company.

Our team is small but strong and we ship things that have tangible impact. Being small, you get to impact more than the product.

We have a flexible vacation policy, full extended benefits, and a flexible work week depending on your needs. We also cover certain education costs and things you need to purchase to be able to work comfortably. In short, we're here for you. :)

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Front End Developer (Shopify/Liquid)
items.content: We're a small remote team focused 100% on building the best ecommerce experiences on the web using Shopify. We're engaged in interesting projects for nationally recognized brands, rapidly growing ecommerce startups and lots of folks in between.

items.title: WordPress Developer
items.content:
The VIP team is a diverse, hard working and kind group of people from a wide variety of backgrounds who bring excellence in software engineering, communication and problem-solving skills to help our clients and partners do amazing things with WordPress. Our company is completely distributed, so we work from anywhere we can find a good broadband connection.

As some of the biggest brands on the web, our clients are often pushing the limits of WordPress. The VIP team works to help our clients get the most out of WordPress, doing everything from providing guidance, to reviewing their code to ensure security and performance, to developing new tools to help improve our platform.

VIP Developers work in three squads, each with different day-to-day responsibilities. Developers have the flexibility to move between squads or stay on one squad.

Launch Squad:
  • Work closely with a client to advise them on the best way to structure their theme or plugins
  • Review code and provide feedback and guidance to client developers
  • Help guide clients through the launch of their sites
  • Assist with content migration
  • Think proactively for clients as they head into launch

Enterprise Squad:
  • Guide large organizations with architectural decisions, including the ongoing development of new features and functionality
  • Understand the organization’s needs at a deep level, and be able to recommend best practices and workflows as well as tools and plugins
  • Review client themes, plugins, and technical integrations
  • Debug complex problems and anticipate potential future needs and challenges

Developer Squad:
  • Debug complex problems encountered by clients
  • Build tools to help the support team be more efficient
  • Work on plugins for clients and the community
  • Do performance audits of sites
  • Add or debug platform level issues impacting all clients
  • Fix security issues impacting the platform or popular plugins
  • Help with occasional day to day code review

You’ll have the ability to set your own schedule outside of a required 4 to 8 hours a week of “on call” time for urgents and code deployments. This will typically fall during your morning or afternoon, although some weekend work is possible.

We’re looking for developers who have:
  • Minimum 2 years of WordPress specific experience – experience with performance and security a bonus
  • Strong debugging skills
  • A desire to learn and grow
  • Great communication skills

Want to learn more about who you’ll be working with? Check out: http://vip.wordpress.com/jobs/

A great way to know if you have the development skills required for the position is to review the Intentionally Vulnerable Plugin and see if you can find the vulnerabilities. Bonus points for catching the VIP specific feedback that you can find here: https://vip.wordpress.com/documentation/code-review-what-we-look-for/

To apply: Find instructions on how to apply here: https://automattic.com/work-with-us/vip-developer/

items.title: Front End Developer @ Fuel Made
items.content:
Front End Developer @ Fuel Made

2017-11-24 18:37

Description

We're a small remote team focused 100% on building the best ecommerce experiences on the web using Shopify. We're engaged in interesting projects for nationally recognized brands, rapidly growing ecommerce startups and lots of folks in between.

Leading out with strong design, a clean and friendly development process, and an attention to quality is how we have delighted our clients, and grown our agency. Our quality-driven approach has led to success, and opportunities we couldn’t have imagined.

Today, our clients are successful, established merchants with specialized shops and complex needs. The opportunity to service these clients is challenging and exciting.

We are seeking an experienced front end web developer to join our small team to help us continue this tradition, leading our clients (and our agency) into the future.

Why you might enjoy working with us:

  • Freedom to really care about what you're doing (we're focused on quality)
  • Freedom to work. We get out of your way and trust you to do what you do best.
  • Freedom to own projects from a development standpoint
  • Freedom to focus and get really good at what you do (we're focused 100% on ecommerce and the Shopify platform)
  • We're selective about the clients we work with.

You:

  • 3+ years professional full time experience as a front end developer
  • Deep appreciation for, and understanding of good web design. You don't need to be a designer, but you should "get it."
  • Expertise in HTML/CSS/Sass/JS
  • Familiar with OOCSS, SMACSS, or BEM
  • Well versed in RWD techniques and mobile performance
  • Write well-structured (vanilla) JavaScript
  • Write your own jQuery plugins
  • Comfortable with building front-end templates using JSON APIs
  • Take pride in clean, readable code
  • Live in western North America, able to work regular business hours every day*.

More importantly -

  • Desire to learn (curiosity)
  • Passion for all things web
  • Willingness to do things the right way (especially, late in the game when it's hard)
  • Easy and enjoyable to work with
  • Have obsessive attention to detail
  • Communicate well in writing

Pluses:

  • Experience with Shopify and/or Liquid.
  • Solid backend full-stack dev experience.
  • Digital agency experience

If you also have experience with Shopify and/or Liquid that's a big plus. If you don't, but are a quick study, we'll help you get up to speed.

The position: You’ll work with our designers who will provide design direction. You’ll typically be the sole developer on your projects, taking full ownership of a project from a development standpoint. We are craftsmen/women. This is a position where your attention to detail and desire to do things right will be encouraged and rewarded.

Benefits:

  • Vacation: Two weeks paid vacation (available from the day you start) plus 7 paid holidays, and we also take off the week between Christmas and New Years.
  • Remote work: Western North America is your office.
  • Health insurance
  • Yearly retreat: Each year we all gather as a team for a week somewhere fun to connect, learn, and have a lot of fun together.

*Location: You must be located in North America, and live in the Pacific or Mountain time zones available to work regular full time hours to be considered for this position.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Western North America (Pacific or Mountain time zones only)

items.title: Senior Software Engineer @ Parse.ly
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer @ Parse.ly

2017-11-24 17:44

Description

Do you enjoy distributed systems, large-scale data analysis, and modern open source stacks? Do you also enjoy engineering management books, and believe in the value of engineering apprenticeship, which can allow junior engineers to level up in their career? If so, you might enjoy being a Senior Software Engineer at Parse.ly.

First, let’s answer a key question: what’s Parse.ly? Well, Parse.ly is a real-time content measurement layer for the entire web. Our analytics platform helps digital storytellers at some of the web's best sites, such as Arstechnica, The New Yorker, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch, The Intercept, Mashable, and many more. In total, our analytics system handles over 65 billion monthly events from over 1 billion monthly unique visitors.

Our entire stack is in Python and JavaScript, and our team has innovated in areas related to real-time analytics, building some of the best open source tools for working with modern stream processing technologies.

On the open source front, we maintain streamparse, the most widely used Python binding for the Apache Storm streaming data system. We also maintain pykafka, the most performant and Pythonic binding for Apache Kafka.

Our colleagues are talented: our UX/design team has also built one of the best-looking dashboards on the planet, using AngularJS and D3.js, and our infrastructure engineers have built a scalable devops-friendly cloud environment.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you would master our backend stack -- or, fill in whatever gaps you might be missing if you already know some of our technologies. But you’d also spend a portion of your time defining a roadmap for our “Customer Success Engineering” group, which is a group of bright engineers, more junior in their career, who are focusing on customer-facing and customer-deployed data integration challenges. It’s an ideal opportunity to put your programming skills to use, while also flexing some engineering and project management skills, to boot.

Responsibilities

Parse.ly’s data engineering team already makes use of modern technologies like Python, Storm, Spark, Kafka, and Elasticsearch to analyze large datasets. As a Software Engineer at Parse.ly, you will be expected to master these technologies, while also being able to write code against them in Python, and debug issues down to the native C code and native JVM code layers, as necessary.

However, your focus will be on deep understanding, commensurate with your technical background. Our product is widely used by over 250 enterprises with over 30,000 active seats, each of whom is viewing our data on a regular basis, and we have a team of engineers who help assist these customers with understanding their data, debugging data integration problems, and investigating code and data discrepancies. You would lead this team with its own focused roadmap of how to apply programming skills to solve customer problems.

Examples of past projects this team has built:

  • A page data debugging tool, using web crawling
  • An automated system for re-processing customer data to correct historical errors
  • A public API explorer tool, for understanding how to use our HTTP/JSON API
  • An admin panel for tracking customer usage, pricing tiers, and invites
  • An Amazon Redshift based data warehouse for doing product usage analytics

If you get excited by the idea of specifying and clarifying requirements around “quick-win” engineering projects that have a huge impact on the business and on how our customers interact with our support team, this is an ideal role for you.

What you'll do

For this role, you should already be a proficient programmer who wants to work with data at scale. You should already have, or be willing to gain, a full level of Python expertise.

In the role, you’ll...

  • Write Python code using the best practices. See The Elements of Python Style, written by our CTO, for an example of our approach to code readability and design.
  • Analyze data at massive scale. You need to be comfortable with the idea of your code running across 3,000 Python cores, thanks to process-level parallelization.
  • Brainstorm new ideas for how automation can solve problems for our customer success team. You need to be a good communicator, especially in written form.
  • Own a product roadmap for "Customer Success Engineering", with a team of at least 5 junior engineers who would execute that roadmap.
  • Directly mentor these 5 engineers as they gain new skills in programming, web development, and data analysis.
  • Master cloud technologies and systems. You should love UNIX and be able to reason about distributed systems.

Benefits

Our distributed team is best-in-class and we happily skip commutes by working out of our ergonomic home offices. Here's a photograph of our CTO's setup running two full-screen Parse.ly dashboards.

  • Work from home or anywhere else in our industry-leading distributed team.
  • Earn a competitive salary and benefits (health/dental/401k).
  • Splurge with a generous equipment budget.
  • Work with one of the brightest teams in tech.
  • Speak at and attend conferences like PyData on Parse.ly's dime.

Parse.ly Tech

  • Python for both backend and frontend -- 2.7, some systems in 3.x, and we're going full-on 3.x soon.
  • Amazon Web Services used for most systems.
  • Modern databases like Cassandra, ElasticSearch, Redis, and Postgres.
  • Frameworks like Django, Tornado and the PyData stack (e.g. Pandas).
  • Running Kafka, Storm, Spark in production atop massive data sets.
  • Easy system management with Fabric and Chef.

Fully distributed team

Parse.ly is a fully distributed team, with engineers working from across the world. People with past experience working remotely will be prioritized. US/Eastern timezones will be prioritized.

Country

United States

Location

EST or CST (or nearby)

items.title: Full Stack Developer (React/Django) @ TimeSpot
items.content:
Full Stack Developer (React/Django) @ TimeSpot

2017-11-24 17:09

Description

TimeSpot is looking for a full stack developer (3+ years of experience) to work remotely. We’re building enterprise SaaS app for time management. As a full-stack developer at TimeSpot, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in Django, React and PostgreSQL, creating production grade JavaScript and Python code.

Who we’re looking for

A smart, motivated and productive developer who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development and care greatly about the craft of coding. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product . We’re a 100% remote company, so you should be autonomous, self-driven, and remote-disciplined. You should care deeply about writing clean, maintainable, well-tested code.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop back-end features using Python and Django.
  • Develop front-end using React/JavaScript
  • Ability to work independently — accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity
  • Create pragmatic OO design and clean code for its long-term cost benefits, and testing
  • Collaborate with the team to ensure product quality, requirements and timelines.
  • Contribute to the overall software development life-cycle including requirements gathering/analysis, design, development, release/version control, testing, deployment and support;
  • Refactoring existing codebase
  • Continuous integration

Technical requirements

  • At least 3 years of experience developing and deploying web sites, applications and APIs
  • At least 2 years of experience with Django/Python
  • At least 2 years of experience working with rich Javascript frameworks/libs – AngularJS, React, JQuery, Bootstrap and the like.
  • Database experience including MySQL and PostgreSQL (queries, design);
  • Strong understanding of software best practices, data structures, algorithms, databases and networks;
  • Experience in designing and developing REST APIs;
  • Experience with distributed source control systems (Git);
  • Fluent English (upper-intermediate or advanced);

About TimeSpot

We are a fully remote company. Bootstrapped and growing very quickly. We have positive and supportive culture. We put a high emphasis on work / life balance.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Lead Developer for Language-Learning Startup
items.content:
Langu is a fast-growing UK-based language-learning startup that has achieved significant traction and is looking for a new full-stack developer to continue development and help us push into new directions. This is an exciting opportunity take the tech reigns of an established startup with tons of room to grow.

The successful candidate will need to work with the existing stack, although we are flexible about what kinds of technologies you choose to develop further features with. The core of the platform is PHP, though you may not need to be a full-on PHP developer.

Must have:
* PHP 5/7 (modern MVC frameworks, preferably Symfony 2.x/3.x)
* Javascript (jQuery)
* Linux administration (preferably Ubuntu)
* Experience working across full software-development lifecycle
* MySQL
* A keen eye for UX/UI

Desirable:
* Javascript (modern front-end framework)
* Experience working with 3rd party APIs
* Ansible, Docker, Redis
* Another modern object-oriented programming language (Java, C#, Python)

We’re looking for someone with a passion for building technologies that connect people, building tools that bring down barriers to language learning.

At the core of your initial responsibilities will be to redevelop our v1 virtual classroom, currently powered by WebRTC (via Tokbox) and Google Realtime API, to include lots more real-time interactive tools and possibly to develop white-label platforms for, among other uses, sports applications. Realtime API will soon be deprecated and needs to be redeveloped using some combination of WebRTC, HTML5 or websockets. This is a big endeavour that will suit someone looking for a major portfolio project.

We are 100% open to remote working arrangements. We’d love to see you in person whenever possible, but we don’t believe in the necessity of a permanent office.

We will consider candidates with a variety of backgrounds, from students/recent grads to seasoned veterans. We place high value in passion, vision and communication skills. And we would ideally begin working with you on a part-time basis and can offer £20-35k pa depending on experience.

We offer:

* The opportunity for a pivotal role at an established early-stage startup, helping lead a revolution in how languages are learned.
* Ability to work from home, with flexibility on your working hours.
* Autonomy in a collaborative and supportive environment.
* The chance to develop exciting and significant projects you can call your own.
* Access to an extensive mentoring network and startup community through our accelerator, Ignite.

A bit about Langu:

* We launched an MVP in late 2016, rebuilt/re-launched the platform in February 2017, taken on 3 small rounds of investment, and are currently part of the Ignite Accelerator in the UK.
* Our platform connects professional language teachers with language students for live online lessons in our own virtual classroom.
* We have achieved significant monthly growth on minimal marketing spend and are looking to reach the next level of scale.
* We’re currently a team of 4, and surrounded by a broad network of committed advisors and investors.

To apply, please send us your CV and include a few words about your interest in the role as well as any links that will help us get to know you and your work better (websites worked on, Github, Twitter, LinkedIn etc).

(Strictly no agencies, please.)

items.title: UI/UX Designer
items.content:
Status

Status is building powerful decentralized apps on Ethereum that change the way we do things on the web. Our rapidly growing team is made up of self-motivated individuals who prosper in a fast-paced environment and value the ability to work from anywhere.

As a product, Status is an open source discovery tool for the Ethereum blockchain that makes it easy for anyone to access apps and services built on the decentralized web. Status also allows users to browse, chat, make payments and more.

Opportunity

Although still in its infancy, blockchain technology is developing rapidly and is poised to have a profound impact on our social, financial and legal systems. By joining us, you’ll help to craft the way people interact with these technologies.

Job role

The UX/UI Designer will be responsible for the overall design strategy of our product, this includes creating scenarios, storyboards, mockups and prototyping. You will work with business and technology partners to increase productivity and opportunities for Status in order to benefit the adoption of blockchain technology.

Responsibilities

  • Define user models and user interfaces for new and existing product and features
  • Proactively drive cooperation within Product Design and contribute to fostering collaboration with other departments
  • Continuously improve design processes, knowledge sharing and tools to measurably enhance productivity and product quality
  • Ensure that the quality of implementation meets design requirements
  • Effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
  • Work in design projects and manage multiple work streams in a fast-paced, changing environment

Requirements

  • Portfolio demonstrating user-centered design approach, problem solving skills and superior attention to detail
  • Work experience 4+ years in interaction/visual design  in a consumer-focused, high performance organization
  • Experience creating great products 
  • Experience with design projects, art direction, conducting design reviews
  • Good prioritisation and time-management skills
  • Fluent English

Working at Status

We're a remote team of made up of 40 people scattered around the globe. Everyone at Status works from a location of their choosing - and we all meet up twice a year to strategize and strengthen our relationships.

We care deeply about open source software, and our organizational structure does away with strict hierarchy and fixed work hours. We believe in working with a high degree of autonomy while supporting the team's priorities.

items.title: User Experience Researcher @ NewCity
items.content:
User Experience Researcher @ NewCity

2017-11-23 21:06

Description

Do you love digging in deep to uncover truths and possibilities in order to craft excellent user experiences? Do you crave opportunities for user testing and research that can inform and shape change for the better in processes and products?

We’re looking for someone with the knowledge, skills, and ability to conduct and lead studies to help build tailored, strategic solutions to our clients’ challenges.

You might be the perfect candidate if you can:

  • Conduct research and effectively analyze user behavior and user data employing both qualitative and quantitative research methods;
  • Develop effective research strategies for clients representing a range of backgrounds, challenges, and budgets;
  • Manage and own all aspects of the research process, such as recruitment, scheduling/coordination, script development, facilitation, analysis, presentation, and usability testing;
  • Facilitate strategy and ideation sessions to bring together the perspectives of the client and our team while keeping the needs of the user at the forefront;
  • Communicate research findings and insights to our team as well as our clients and their stakeholders in clear, concise and compelling ways;
  • Design and prototype research-informed user experiences;
  • Demonstrate a strong ability to understand tools (individual components) and systems (the people, process, and technology that combine to produce outcomes): how they work, how they break, why they are important;
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver high-quality results quickly; and Work collaboratively with team members and clients.

You must be fluent in written and spoken English. At least 2 years of hands-on, professional, applied usability testing and/or user experience research and a bachelor’s degree are required.

This posting is for a full-time position with the team in our Blacksburg, Virginia, office. Think great quality of life in a vibrant college town nestled in the mountains. Our office is pretty cool too.

Working from the Blacksburg office is preferred, but we are open to remote work for the right fit. You must be authorized to work in the U.S. full-time.

THE COMPANY

NewCity is a 21 year-old, 30-person firm. We work in a highly collaborative, low-ego environment to create effective digital experiences for the real world. We ask big questions, dream big dreams, and set our sights on accomplishing aggressive goals for clients and our work. We’re constantly learning, experimenting, and reinventing NewCity.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

Equal Employment Opportunity is a fundamental principle of NewCity. As an equal opportunity employer, employment is based upon personal and professional capabilities, qualifications and performance. NewCity does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability or any other legally protected status. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package. We are unable to offer work visa sponsorships.

Country

United States

items.title: Google Analytics Specialist @ NewCity
items.content:
Google Analytics Specialist @ NewCity

2017-11-23 21:04

Description

NewCity, a digital agency in Blacksburg, Virginia is looking for an experienced Google Analytics Specialist to join our team. You will work with our staff to create results-driven web properties and campaigns for our clients.

The ideal candidate will be our in-house expert on all things Google Analytics (GA) and will have experience designing and implementing measurement strategies for websites and digital marketing campaigns. Google Analytics Individual Qualification preferred.

THE COMPANY

NewCity is a 21 year-old, 30 person firm. We work in a highly collaborative, low-ego environment to create effective digital experiences for the real world. We ask big questions, dream big dreams, and set our sights on accomplishing aggressive goals for clients and our work. We’re constantly learning, experimenting, and reinventing NewCity.

THE WORK

Analytics and data are an important part of the work we do at NewCity. The Analytics Specialist leads our analytics practices and helps all the teams at NewCity use data properly and effectively.

As an Analytics Specialist at NewCity, you will:

  • Onboard new clients, audit their current GA setup, and make potential configuration changes to deal with data quality or completeness issues
  • Establish baseline metrics and compile data to present to NewCity teams and clients
  • Implement Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and other complex analytics setups
  • Perform analysis of data, work with project teams to identify optimization opportunities, and present findings and recommendations to teams and clients

THE REQUIREMENTS

To be be considered for the Google Analytics Specialist position, we’re looking for candidates who:

  • Have 2 years or more of professional experience configuring and working with Google Analytics
  • Have 2 years or more of professional experience configuring and working with Google Tag Manager
  • Maintain an active Google Analytics Individual Qualification
  • Have experience reading and writing code, ideally Javascript
  • Have experience working with cross-disciplinary teams in web design and development, and / or digital marketing

Additionally, we’re looking for someone who:

  • Has statistical and analytical knowledge and abilities
  • Possesses great written and oral communication skills
  • Excels at working on teams and across disciplines
  • Is organized and able to manage their own work and handle multiple projects
  • Proactive and results-focused
  • Has both personal and professional integrity

This posting is for a full-time position with the team in our Blacksburg, Virginia, office. Working from the Blacksburg office is preferred, but we are open to remote work for the right fit.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

Equal Employment Opportunity is a fundamental principle of NewCity. As an equal opportunity employer, employment is based upon personal and professional capabilities, qualifications and performance. NewCity does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability or any other legally protected status.

We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package.

We are unable to offer work visa sponsorships.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Senior Techops Engineer @ Swiftype
items.content:
Senior Techops Engineer @ Swiftype

2017-11-23 20:40

Description

At Swiftype reliability and speed are key components of our product, and we place tremendous importance on providing a service that exceeds our customers' expectations in those respects. Consequently, we've invested heavily in our operations and infrastructure systems, and we're looking for Senior Technical Operations Engineers to help us continue improving and evolving our systems as we scale. Our ideal candidate will have prior experience working on SaaS products.

Sample Projects

  • Design and build an infrastructure for storing tens to hundreds of millions of documents across multiple datacenters.
  • Work with the development team to design and implement multi-datacenter architecture for a web application.
  • Implement a continuous deployment pipeline for a Rails application.
  • Design the next generation of our crawling infrastructure.
  • Continuously work on improving Swiftype software performance and infrastructure reliability.

Required Skills (non-negotiable)

  • Excellent practical judgement. You should know how to effectively allocate your time when solving hard problems.
  • Expert-level knowledge of at least one programming language.

Qualifications (the more the better)

  • Experience with highly-available, distributed, and multi-datacenter applications.
  • Experience deploying Ruby, Rails, and Nginx+Lua in high-scale environments.
  • Experience deploying Java in high-scale environments.
  • Experience deploying and tuning MySQL servers, designing highly available architectures based on MySQL.
  • Familiarity with Chef, Puppet or similar tools.
  • Familiarity with Hadoop Ecosystem (Zookeeper, Hive, HBase).
  • Experience with open source search software, especially Lucene/Elasticsearch/Solr.
  • Familiarity with web crawling and elastic workloads.

If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you. Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code samples, links to personal projects, etc.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Software Engineer - Integrations (f/m) @ ChartMogul
items.content:
Software Engineer - Integrations (f/m) @ ChartMogul

2017-11-23 20:19

Description

One of ChartMogul's engineering challenges is building and maintaining a large number of third-party integrations which our customers rely on - from Stripe, Braintree and Recurly (and 9 others) who manage our customers' billing, to other services like Clearbit and Intercom which let our customers enrich their data further. And as we grow, we're going to build even more integrations.

The Software Engineer - Integrations will be responsible for building and maintaining integrations with ChartMogul. It's a position with end-to-end responsibility to design, build, launch and support integrations that you build in collaboration with Product Management. Some new integrations in the pipeline are with Salesforce, Slack, Segment, and Shopify. We also plan to upgrade some of our existing integrations like the one with PayPal.

This is a full-time remote position.

Requirements

  • Several years experience building and maintaining high availability web software.
  • You're comfortable developing and deploying in a micro-services environment.
  • You have extensive experience working with different kinds of APIs.
  • Experience in Ruby or Python and at least one other language.
  • Experience working on multiple simultaneous projects.
  • Fluent, professional English.

Nice to have

  • Exposure to e-commerce, billing systems, or subscriptions.
  • Experience working as a remote software engineer.
  • Experience with the Go programming language.
  • Prior experience with the ChartMogul API.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Web Designer / Developer (f/m) @ ChartMogul
items.content:
Web Designer / Developer (f/m) @ ChartMogul

2017-11-23 20:18

Description

ChartMogul helps people build better subscription businesses through data. Subscription businesses — like SaaS products, monthly gift boxes, streaming media platforms, and even local gyms — are highly measurable and generate a wealth of valuable data. We make it easier for them to track the revenue and customer metrics they depend on to maintain and grow their business. We serve more than 1,000 businesses around the world, spanning these verticals and more.

We’re on the hunt for a full-time Web Developer and Designer. This person will be responsible for the look, feel and functionality of ChartMogul.com, and will work closely with the design, marketing and engineering teams.

This position requires someone who is ready to have a major and measurable impact on a small but growing startup. You should be comfortable collaborating with design and marketing to spec out and rapidly build web pages, but also be ready to own large-scale web projects from start to finish.

As a Web Developer and Designer, you’ll:

  • Be a critical part of our inbound marketing program
  • Identify new lead generation strategies and UX innovations on chartmogul.com
  • Collaborate with marketers, designers and engineers in a fast-paced environment
  • Manage projects from initial concept through development, QA, staging and production deployment
  • Execute and present web designs that are beautiful, effective and responsive
  • Discover opportunities to minimize pain points within our infrastructure and code base
  • Stay up-to-date on web design and development trends, and keep us honest when it comes to user-centric best practices

Requirements

What we’re looking for:

  • A minimum of 3+ years experience with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, DOM scripting, and jQuery in a production environment
  • A detail-oriented and collaborative self-starter — someone who can maintain complete focus despite multiple competing priorities and work streams
  • Experience with Git and Github and a high comfort level in handling frequent complex merges
  • Experience using Static Site Generators
  • Knowledge of content targeting, conversion rate optimization, funnel optimization, and B2B lead generation is desired
  • Expert knowledge of performance optimization and how it impacts user behavior and conversion
  • Solid experience with website analytics — specifically Google Analytics — and optimization tools and A/B testing best practices
  • Experience turning wireframes and mockups into HTML / CSS with a working knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator and Sketch
  • Expert knowledge of CSS preprocessors / SASS
  • Passion for design, user experience, marketing and information architecture
  • A college degree is preferred, but not necessary
  • Fluency in both written and spoken English

Bonus Skills:

  • Experience with digital illustration and motion graphics, with examples you don’t mind sharing

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Frontend Engineer – Business Solutions @ SurveyMonkey
items.content:
Frontend Engineer – Business Solutions @ SurveyMonkey

2017-11-23 20:10

Description

About SurveyMonkey

Founded in 1999, SurveyMonkey is the world’s leading platform for turning people’s voices and opinions into actionable data — People Powered Data. Whether it’s with customers, employees, or a target market, SurveyMonkey helps curious individuals and companies — including 99% of the Fortune 500 — have conversations at scale with the people who matter most. It’s People Powered Data that allows them to understand not only “what” is happening, but “why.” SurveyMonkey’s 700+ employees throughout North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific are dedicated to powering the curious.

About SurveyMonkey Business Solutions

SurveyMonkey’s platform is used for a myriad of purposes across a broad spectrum of industries. That leaves ample opportunity to build targeted products that solve a specific problem. That’s where our team comes in. We’re responsible for building standalone solutions that address the needs of businesses.

So far, we’ve built three solutions:

  • SurveyMonkey CX - Measure and improve customer satisfaction
  • SurveyMonkey Engage - Understand and foster employee engagement
  • TechValidate - Publish 3rd-party verified customer proof

We operate each solution as a small startup within the larger SurveyMonkey organization. This affords us flexibility to quickly try new ideas, but with the resources of larger company. Our goal is to build high growth, profitable businesses that leverage the enormous user base of SurveyMonkey.

The Team

Our ten person team is responsible for building products from soup to nuts. We often wear many hats and work across both the technical stack and departments. You’ll have the opportunity to work with people who have successfully launched (and sold) products.

Most of us choose to focus on one solution at a time. We feel this allows us to fully embrace and understand our customer needs and develop a deep technical understanding of the problem domain. However, we are also committed to sharing our work - not just with each other, but via open source contributions to our code library, Pano.

Who We’re Looking For

We are looking for an experienced front-end engineer who has worked on Ruby on Rails applications. You should be a CSS expert and appreciate the clarity of Haml and Sass. Interest beyond the view layer is always welcome - either delving into controllers or models, or bringing an eye for design. Experience with HTML emails will also come in handy.

You should be fluent in Javascript. While we are skeptical of Javascript frameworks, we embrace ES6. Knowledge of D3 is a plus. Understanding of Turbolinks will serve you well.

Overall, you’ll need a strong command of web standards and cross-browser compatibility. You should be able to demonstrate relevant past experience working on complex web applications.

Why Work Here?

We are a remote team. As long as your work day overlaps the Pacific timezone by at least four hours, where you live and work and up to you. You will be asked to travel a few times a year for a full team meeting. We use this time not only for larger planning discussions, but also for a little social interaction. In the past year, we’ve gone bowling in Phoenix and made sushi in San Francisco.

We are strong believers in work-life balance. We know world class work can be done in just forty hours a week when distractions are minimized and the pace is sustainable. If you consider yourself to be a manager of one, this role is a great fit.

We offer competitive salaries, medical/dental benefits, generous PTO, 401k, paid holidays, and equity compensation.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

As long as your work day overlaps the Pacific timezone by at least four hours, where you live and work and up to you.

items.title: Front-End Software Developer @ Curoverse
items.content:
Front-End Software Developer @ Curoverse

2017-11-23 19:57

Description

Build a free/open source software platform to transform health care through the analysis of genomic and biomedical data sets.

JOB DESCRIPTION

At Curoverse, you'll work on a small team of software engineers to build the Arvados platform and the Curoverse products that are based on Arvados.

  • Work with modern web application frameworks
  • Create powerful visual tools for data science
  • Use scrum in an agile, self-managed team of peers
  • Develop elegant, responsive, user experiences
  • Contribute to a free/open source platform and community

WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO...

  • Loves writing code
  • Works well in a small team of peers
  • Is an experienced open source coder (Ruby on Rails, CSS/HTML5, Javascript)
  • Works with modern javascript UI frameworks (e.g. Mithril, React, Angular)
  • Has experience in a successful technology company
  • Can work in a fast-paced startup environment (startup experience ideal)

WHY WORK HERE

  • Work that matters - Build software that will be the backbone of modern medicine and data-driven business.
  • Hard problems - Solve hard, interesting software engineering problems in distributed computing and big data.
  • Diverse tasks - We have a small team with a big project, so you won't be stuck working in some corner.
  • Free software - All of our code is AGPLv3, except SDKs which are Apache 2.0.
  • Sustainable lifestyle - Do great work and have time and energy for the other things life has to offer.

COMPENSATION

We offer competitive salaries, stock options, health/dental/vision, flexible time off, and other benefits you’d expect from a more established company.

LOCATION

We prefer candidates who are based in the Boston area or can relocate, but we are open to remote employees.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Senior Software Developer (Golang) @ Curoverse
items.content:
Senior Software Developer (Golang) @ Curoverse

2017-11-23 19:55

Description

Accelerate data science by building the free software platform for verifiable large scale computation.

JOB DESCRIPTION

At Curoverse , you'll work on a small team of senior software developers to build the Arvados platform and the Curoverse products that are based on Arvados.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Program in Golang, Javascript, Python, Ruby
  • Work on hard distributed computing problems
  • Use scrum in an agile, self-managed team of peers
  • Develop big-data storage and analytical systems
  • Help create a massive, in-memory, real-time query engine
  • Contribute to a free/open source platform and community

WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO...

  • Has a solid background in Golang
  • Loves writing and improving code
  • Works well in a small team of peers
  • Has used multiple programming languages to build production systems
  • Has substantial experience contributing to free software projects
  • Has experience with big data and distributed computing systems
  • Can work in a fast-paced startup environment

OUR STACK

Some of the technologies we use: Debian, Ubuntu, CentOS, Docker, Git, Golang, Javascript, Jenkins, jQuery, Nginx, PostgreSQL, Python, Puppet, Rails, Ruby, Twitter Bootstrap.

WHY WORK HERE

  • Work that matters - Build software that will be the backbone of modern medicine.
  • Hard problems - Solve software engineering problems in distributed computing and big data.
  • Diverse tasks - We have a small team with a big project, so you won't be stuck working in some corner.
  • Free software - Your code will be released under AGPLv3 / Apache 2.0.
  • Sustainable lifestyle - Do great work and have time and energy for the other things life has to offer.
  • Convenient office location - Our office is right in Davis Square, Somerville.

COMPENSATION

We offer competitive salaries, stock options, health/dental/vision, flexible time off, and other benefits.

LOCATION

We prefer candidates who are based in the Boston area or can relocate, but we are open to remote employees.

Anywhere

items.title: Software Engineer @ Elation Health
items.content:
Software Engineer @ Elation Health

2017-11-23 19:50

Description

Our San Francisco-based team is committed to enhancing physician and patient quality of life through Elation, a SaaS cloud-based clinical platform. Since inception, we’ve been focused on building a delightful world-class experience that empowers physicians to deliver phenomenal care to patients.

Elation is looking for a Software Engineer with deep understanding of both web and server-side programming, technologies, and scalability challenges. Elation’s development team is a small group of experienced and talented engineers who are passionate about our product and our users. As a member of the team you’ll be involved in product design and development, work on all parts of the stack, and deploy your changes to production weekly.

We strongly believe that great talent and ideas can come from anywhere and we've built a development team that is distributed across our SF HQ and in a handful of remote locations around the globe. Remote candidates are encouraged to apply!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design and develop new product features on all parts of the stack
  • Collaborate with design, product, and QA teams to deliver projects with measurable business results
  • Suggest and drive improvement on all parts of the stack and internal development processes
  • Help our skilled support team triage bugs and troubleshoot production issues
  • Learn from and mentor other engineers and participate in code reviews

EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS

  • 7+ experience as a full stack developer in a fast-paced startup (or equivalent)
  • Strong proficiency in Python, Django, JavaScript, React, and Redux
  • Proficiency with MySQL and relational database modeling
  • Experience with ElasticSearch, Redis, Celery, AWS
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and strong sense of empathy
  • Ability to juggle competing priorities in a fast-moving dynamic environment
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience

BONUS POINTS

  • Knowledge of, or strong interest in, the US healthcare industry and common technologies used
  • Experience with mobile development
  • Comfortable serving in product management capacity if/when needed

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Software Engineer, Monetization @ GSN Games
items.content:
Software Engineer, Monetization @ GSN Games

2017-11-23 19:41

Description

GSN Games is looking for a Software Engineer, Monetization to join our team in San Fran, Los Angeles, New York or Boston! We even have 100% remote flexibility for the right candidate.

About the Ads Team:

We deliver advertising experiences that are a win-win for both our partners and players. From custom games and sponsored prizes to targeting and engagement analytics, we help brands share their story with millions of players.

What You'll Do:

This Software Engineer will support our Advertising division by developing and deploying advertising technologies and solutions across our iOS and Android mobile games applications. The individual needs to be a flexible self-starter who thrives on the challenges of working with new and varied technologies to unlock revenue opportunities with innovative advertising products and solutions. A successful candidate will need to understand the entire mobile stack and be able to build core application features and frameworks within our platform.

Primary Responsibilities Include:

  • Working with team members to design, build and maintain new/existing advertising features and products across our suite of iOS & Android mobile games
  • Working with team members to integrate 3rd party advertising products, platforms, and SDKs
  • Assisting with production support, system diagnosis and troubleshooting
  • Defining best practices to deliver the most impactful results
  • Leveraging cross-platform toolkits such as Unity to help accelerate Mobile Development
  • Coordinating with Artists, QA, and other internal developers to help maintain best practices for mobile app development
  • Writing clean, readable, modular code that is reusable code and well documented

About You:

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent required
  • 5+ Years of professional programming experience
  • Experience with Unity SDK, C#, JavaScript, iOS, Android
  • Experienced Application Developer with launched/published products for iOS / Android required
  • Proficiencies desired: Objective-C, iOS, Android, Unity, HTML5, JavaScript, CSS
  • Expertise at mobile optimization / best practices
  • Experience with object-oriented design and implementation
  • Experience with source code management in a collaborative environment
  • Experience with API creation / management

Bonus Points!

  • An understanding mobile advertising formats (video, reward video, interstitials, display)
  • Familiarity with mediation platforms, vendors (Fuse Powered, Supersonic, Fyber, AdMob, AdX, DoubleClick) and their SDKs

About Us:

GSN Games delivers social casino and skill-based games designed to fuel every player’s inner winner. Founded in 1999, the company has evolved into one of the world’s top game publishers and creators. Its collection of social casino games includes GSN Casino and Bingo Bash, both top 10 grossing iPad apps, as well as Wheel of Fortune Slots: The Ultimate Collection, Solitaire TriPeaks, Mirrorball Slots, Fresh Deck Poker and more. GSN Games is the maker of Sparcade, the world’s first app where players can compete for money in skill-adapted versions of the biggest game franchises of all time within a vibrant, trusted community. Owned by Sony Pictures Entertainment and AT&T Entertainment Group, GSN Games operates studios worldwide in the U.S., U.K., Spain, Ukraine, Israel and India. Connect with us on Twitter @insidegsngames, on Instagram @gsngames and on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/company/gsn.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Front-end Developer
items.content:
About Us

We’re Eight. We create digital products that have helped over 10,000 of the biggest (and smallest) eCommerce companies sell more online. We’re growing our team and we want you to be part of it.

We’re a small and fully remote team of designers, developers and project managers who work together (to varying degrees) and experiment with how to do things.

Being 100% remote, we’re well versed in the tools that make it such an enjoyable way of working, including Slack, Zoom, Jira and Github. We work in an agile way and you will see and feel an immediate impact with the collective efforts of the team.

We’re building a company and a team we love and we’re in it for the long run.

The Role

We’re seeking a front-end developer to help us out with an increasing workload, working primarily (to begin with) on Shopify themes, and the front-end for upcoming and existing apps, both enterprise and SaaS.

As a remote team across time zones, we have a flexible approach to your work schedule, however we would usually expect you to cross at least 5 hours of 8am - 6pm Monday to Friday GMT (we finish an hour earlier on Fridays) during your first year of working with us, and although this is a remote position, we are only looking for people in the EU and GMT +/- 2h.

Required knowledge and experience

  • High level of experience using HTML, SASS, JavaScript.
  • Familiarity with Github.
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Positivity and awesomeness. You are excited about being an integral part of a growing start-up and are great at finding creative solutions and workarounds when needed.
  • You take initiative and ownership and need little supervision, and have experience of working remotely.

Desirable knowledge and experience

  • Experience with the Shopify platform (Liquid)
  • Experience with Ionic/Angular
  • Experience with React/Django

Benefits

  • Starting salary £26k - £32k
  • Co-working space allowance
  • Budget for home-working set up, your choice of laptop etc
  • Pension scheme (UK-based employees)
  • Great holiday entitlement - 30 days holiday a year

To apply: Please email us at hello@weareeight.com with a short summary of why you think you are perfect for the role. CV, LinkedIn and/or GitHub links most welcome.
