  • You must be living in North America, South America or Europe
  • Fluent with both verbal and written English
  • React Native code samples you can share OR willingness to complete a 6-8 hour code challenge (priority will be given to candidates that can provide code samples)
  • 30-40 hours per week of availability
  • Mid-Senior or Senior level Position (4+ years of professional experience)
  • 3+ months of React Native experience (with a production app)

Nice to have's:

  • Full stack experience (Rails or Node.js)
  • Professional Obj-C or Java experience (Helpful when working with native modules using React Native)
  • 6+ months of React Native experience
  • Experience with Apollo Client & GraphQL

Onsite travel is not required but is often appreciated by our partners (Please let us know if that is an option)

We have other React & React Native roles and we'll invite you to join our developer community if we think you are a good fit!

Apply:

items.title: Front End Engineer - Angular2+ @ Modus Create
items.content:
Front End Engineer - Angular2+ @ Modus Create

2017-11-16 19:59

Description

You are a forward thinking, creative problem solver with a passion for core JavaScript. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet. At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles.

This contract role may be performed from a remote location and requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week.

Responsibilities

  • Develop features for device agnostic mobile apps using Angular2+ and Ionic2+
  • Collaborate daily with a cross functional team in a distributed environment
  • Consult to our end client regarding development best practices

Required Skills and Experience

  • Experience delivering high value, heavy UI front-end products
  • Experience with Redux (ngrx/store or ng2-redux)
  • Good understanding of front-end component based architectures
  • Strong experience with Angular2+
  • Previous experience building apps with Ionic
  • Experience with RxJs Observable patterns
  • Strong Javascript basis and very good understand of the JS core (ES6/7)
  • Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
  • Experience with at least one of the SCSS compilers Sass or Less
  • Experience in following Agile/Scrum SDLC
  • Be comfortable communicating in a virtual environment* A consistent, reliable internet connection

Let’s Talk about You

You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.

You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.

You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 100 people in 26 countries in 6 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

Why Modus Create

  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech company? Let’s start a conversation.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

You must be willing to support, at least, the morning business hours of our client located in GMT-4 Time Zone. 8 AM to 12 Noon Eastern Time Zone of the United States.

items.title: Full Time: Sr. JavaScript Developer at Sticker Mule in Remote
items.content:
Sticker Mule is the Internet's fastest growing printing company. We are privately-owned, profitable and powered by an outstanding remote team that supports the growth of our manufacturing operations. We aim to build one of the Internet’s best technical teams. Currently, our development team operates in 8 countries and we’re always looking for more exceptional developers to join us.

Why we enjoy working here
1. We work flexible hours with an asynchronous culture.
2. We work at a sustainable pace without unreasonable external deadlines.
3. Varied, interesting technical challenges to work on.
4. Opportunities to make a large impact as part of a small, highly motivated team.

What we look for
https://www.stickermule.com/blog/characteristics-we-look-for-in-team-members

What you'll do
1. Design, build, test and maintain single page applications and front-end features.
2. Continually look for ways to improve the performance and user experience of our site.
3. Write clean, performant code in accordance with our team’s code style guidelines.
4. Work to improve and maintain the code health of our front-end code.
5. Collaborate with team leads and stakeholders to ensure that we’re always building the best possible solution in the optimal way.
6. Participate in peer code reviews.
7. Share expertise with other members of the team, mentor junior developers.

About you
1. You have a minimum of 3 years professional software development experience.
2. You’re an expert in JavaScript and related tooling such as Webpack.
3. You’re obsessed with front-end performance.
4. You ideally have experience with React + Redux.
5. You possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
6. You have great written and verbal communication skills in English.

Application requirements
1. Applicants will be sent a Hackerrank test within 1-3 business days of applying.
2. Test must be completed within 5 business days.

items.title: Java, Scala or Clojure developer (mid/senior level) - Europe
items.content:
Java, Scala or Clojure developer (mid/senior level) - Europe - Jobmote

Java, Scala or Clojure developer (mid/senior level) - Europe

Real Audience

Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence/Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a talented Java, Scala or Clojure developer. We write functional code in Clojure/Scala, but Java and working JVM knowledge is a great foundation - we will leave room for you to develop skills in the languages that are new to you. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that live in Central or Eastern European countries.

Your main responsibility will be to contribute to our systems for data processing, built in Clojure and Scala and powered by Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra etc.

You should have a sense for:

  • Clear and concise code

  • Test Driven Development (TDD)

  • Working with agile methodology, such as Scrum

  • Common tools, such as Git

  • Working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should:

  • Have experience in Java development and knowledge of JVM
  • Have experience with Clojure development
  • Have experience with Scala development
  • Have experience with Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Amazon AWS
  • Have at least five years of professional programming background
  • Experience with Cassandra databases; data modelling and CQL
  • Have an interest in high software quality

Additionally, you:

  • Seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • Inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • Are a passionate developer, proud of the quality of your work
  • Are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • Are able to communicate well in spoken and written English
  • Are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland, Norway or other European countries for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • Live within the CEE-area (for example Poland, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Russia, Croatia etc.), where we currently have developers

Bonus points for:

  • An interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions
  • A university degree in technology, science or other relevant areas

We offer:

  • An opportunity for you to work with, and create, cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence
  • Work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch
  • No technical dept
  • Stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • A great and experienced remote team
  • A permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice)
  • Salary range €2500 - €4000

items.title: Backend Java Developer - Casumo - (Malta / Barcelona / Remote (from EU zone)) - FullTime
items.content:
• Casumo (Malta / Barcelona / Remote (from EU zone))
  • Fulltime Job

    • Backend Java Developer

    Full time / Experienced

    What would be your role?

    Casumo is agile so we expect you to take on a broad spectrum of tasks. Together we will work to realize our dreams and visions of how the world’s best gaming site should look and work. We are looking for developers who are driven and won’t say no to a challenge but also they have to care for what they do as we expect taking responsibility for the code written.

    Who are you?

    Someone who likes to work in a flat organization.

    Someone who enjoys autonomy.

    Driven and motivated.

    A team player.

    Willing to work out of our offices in Malta or Barcelona, or on remote as part of our distributed workforce.

    A nice person that can bear conversations about unicorns.

    A Backend Java Developer at Casumo:

    Is native in Java, but speaks and writes Bash, SQL and Python. If you have any experience with Kotlin, Scala or Javascript it’s not impossible that you’ll get to practice that too.

    Has an interest both in the big picture and for the small details, a key to work in our tightly knit team.

    Likes freedom with responsibility and would feel comfortable in an environment of developer anarchy.

    Has a desire to take full ownership of features and code, from inception of ideas to deployment, maintenance and keeping it running.

    Appreciates the concepts and principles underlying open-source culture and good software development.

    Is a person who loves to play with code, understands the need of quality and cares about it

    Gets curious when we say CQRS, Event Sourcing or MicroServices. Feels very comfortable in a Linux environment and working with tools like Git.

    It’s a plus if you have experience with transaction-heavy, distributed systems, messaging, MicroServices or tools such as MySQL, RabbitMQ, Docker, Spring, Dropwizard or Jenkins/TeamCity.

    Would be stoked to build the world’s best gaming experience together with other Casumos from our headquarters in sunny Malta, Barcelona or on remote.

    About Casumo:

    Casumo is a recognized and award-winning online casino formed in 2012. We’re a bunch of nerdy game enthusiasts who believe that the right people, tools and technology drive innovation and have the potential to disrupt entire industries. With our passion for games we’re on a mission to create a better reality for the many people through play and we’re always looking for like-minded to join our adventure.

    We’re a flat organization which means we stay away from unnecessary titles and corporate gibberish. We believe in hiring great people and get out of their way, and that’s where you come in. Being different is good, and our mantra “You’re weird, I like you”, helps us keeping things fresh, original and playful. Our work style is characterized by transparency, humbleness, speed and an entrepreneurial culture, with autonomous, cross-functional teams working closely together towards a clear vision. We never stop playing and we never stop learning. Together, we’re writing the future of gaming. Are you ready for a new adventure?

    Perks and benefits @ Casumo

    Dreamy office locations

    Enjoy sun, beautiful surroundings and a welcoming culture

    Great health and medical plans

    If something happens to you, we’ve got your back

    Legendary company trips

    We work, twerk and celebrate our goals together with a bang

    Weekly office activities

    Join the board games club, relax with yoga, play football or just grab a cheeky Friday beer in our bar.

    Trust & Flexibility

    Work in a flat structure with inspiring colleagues and lots of room to learn and grow

    Creativity bonanza

    work with like-minded masterminds and the latest tech on building amazing things

    How to apply

    https://www.casumocareers.com/backend-java-developer/?utm_source=Smashingmagazine&utm_medium=Paying%20job%20portal&utm_content=gb&utm_term=%23REF

items.title: Lead Software Developer / Technical Project Manager
items.content:
Lead Software Developer / Technical Project Manager - Jobmote

Lead Software Developer / Technical Project Manager

MapLarge

100% Remote:  This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). 

Who We Need: We are looking for talented software developers to act as lead developers in a customer facing, technical project manager role.  Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer.  We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and examples come together to make both the UI components and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use.

Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities.  You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application.

Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role:

items.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer
items.content:
Senior JavaScript Engineer at Knack

United States, Remote · Full Time
Skills
MongoDB, Node.js, Mongoose, Data Security, Apache Solr, Express.js
Compensation
$80K–$120K
0.5%–2.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

We're looking for senior software engineers who love what they do and are looking for an awesome product and team to commit to.

The biggest difference at Knack? Our engineers are highly autonomous and engaged members of the team that collaborate beyond just engineering.

What You'll Do
Contribute! We want our engineers to make a major impact on the Knack product. This means you're not just implementing features that have been specified to death. It includes developing ideas, making suggestions, and keeping on top of new tech to understand how we can best leverage opportunities.

Engage your passion! We want to leverage what you're excited about and use that to make Knack a better product.

Program every day and publish many times every week.

Evaluate existing code and redesign for increased performance and reliability.

Help develop features missing from the current app to make Knack the go-to place for building online databases. There are so many amazing things we can do.

Build tools and processes to improve our operations and help us detect and respond to issues.

Our stack is mainly JS: Node.js, MongoDB, Solr, jQuery, Backbone, AWS, and Git.

What We're Looking For
* Efficiency and productivity, i.e. the ability to get sh!# done.
* Great communication. If you like to go off to your bunker and only pop up on occasion this isn't for you.
* Experience executing with large-scale applications.
* Experience working with another startup before or in other fast-moving environments.
* A desire to be a part of a long-term, profitable business that makes a great product loved by thousands of customers.

About Knack
We’re building a profitable long-term business with a product our customers love.

items.title: Frontend Vue.js Engineer
items.content:
Frontend Vue.js Engineer at Knack

Earth, United States, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Javascript, HTML, CSS, Front-End Development, UI/UX Design, Responsive Design, Product Design, Vue.Js
Compensation
$85K–$120K
1.0%–3.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

More about Knack and this position:

https://knack.com
https://knack.com/about
https://www.knack.com/work-at-knack
https://www.knack.com/jobs/front-end-engineer#job-applications/apply2/5420897dd3385df425055419/

Knack is hiring a frontend engineer! You’ll be an integral part of our product and engineering teams focused on architecting and developing our client-side programming.

We’re looking for a strong track record of architecting and building products. With that said, we’re not looking for a 100% match on experience or our stack. If you have a history of shipping solid work, we’re interested.

*What You'll Do*
* Lead development on the client layer and user experience.
* Develop a comprehensive HTML/CSS/JS framework for rendering web applications for multiple devices and themes.
* Refine the application building experience that makes it a delight for our customers to use and extend Knack.
* Consistently improve the speed, reliability, and performance of the Knack client application.
* Evaluate new technologies and help determine opportunities to leverage these.
* Work on implementing front-end Knack features.

How you’ll do this:
* Program: ship code every day
* Contribute: we want our engineers to make an impact on the Knack product. This means you're not just implementing features that have been specified to death. It includes developing ideas, making suggestions, and keeping on top of new tech to understand opportunities.
* Engage: we have enough areas of need where we want to leverage what you're excited about and use that to make Knack a better product.
* Learn and grow: we do code-reviews, pair-programming, lunch-and-learns, and actively engage in chat to constantly teach and learn.

You won’t have a direct boss but will be working collaboratively with our small engineering team of 10, and with cross-functional teams on specific projects.

Our work is 100% remote. We use Slack, Trello, Google Docs and Google Hangouts to get our work done.

*About You*
Above all, you build things. You have a history of starting --and completing-- projects, whether that’s products, applications, games, libraries, or plugins.

You’re both a teacher and a learner. You’re not afraid to admit when someone may know more than you. You have the confidence to help others level up.

You’re an outstanding communicator. You can document a problem, and clearly and succinctly outline a solution. You’re not afraid to distill things into plain English for teammates and customers.

You have experience working in fast-paced environments, prioritizing and balancing multiple projects, and working with cross-functional teams.

You want to work on a product you can be proud of that impacts thousands of people all over the world, from non-profits to the world’s biggest companies.

You go all in. You want to do your best work, and have that work make an impact.

*About Knack*
Knack is a no-code platform that makes it easy for anyone to build applications and workflows to do amazing things with their data.

Knack launched in 2012 and has been growing steadily as we’ve built our team, perfected our product, and nailed our product-market fit. We’re now ready to take things to the next level and maximize the opportunity for what this product can be.

So why are we different?

We’re bootstrapped: we’ve had to build something our customers actually pay for. This changes how you do things.

We’re 100% remote: and have been from the beginning. Every decision we’ve made has been based around optimizing our remote operations.

We’re small: and we like it that way. We’re more than just chat avatars-- we’ve all gotten to know each other, have grown together, and love working with each other.

We enjoy the journey: we’re in this for the long haul. We’re not chasing an exit or the next round of funding. We’re building something we’re proud of and want to keep improving on.

*Benefits & Compensation*
Competitive salaries and generous equity: rather than give up equity to investors to pay engineering salaries, we’ve chosen to give more of that equity to our team while still paying strong salaries.

Define your work: our only rule is our overlap zone of 11am to 4pm EST. Otherwise find the location, environment, and schedule that is best for your life and work. It’s not about separation, it’s about optimization.

Unlimited Paid Vacation: take the time you need to stay motivated, charged, and balanced. You’ll get forced days off for birthdays and knackiversaries.

Paid Corporate Retreats: we get together twice a year at amazing locations to do normal human being things in person. We pay for your flight, lodging, and meals.

Learning Credits: an annual allowance is provided to stay on top of your game with classes, books, and conferences.

HealthCare: we offer health, vision, and dental, covering 75% of the premium for you and your dependents (spouse + children).

Please note that we are only considering applicants legally eligible to work in the US.

items.title: Backend Java Developer
items.content:
Backend Java Developer - Jobmote

Backend Java Developer

Casumo

Backend Java Developer

Full time / Experienced

Malta / Barcelona / Remote (from EU zone)

 

What would be your role?

Casumo is agile so we expect you to take on a broad spectrum of tasks. Together we will work to realize our dreams and visions of how the world’s best gaming site should look and work. We are looking for developers who are driven and won’t say no to a challenge but also they have to care for what they do as we expect taking responsibility for the code written.

Who are you?

Someone who likes to work in a flat organization.

Someone who enjoys autonomy.

Driven and motivated.

A team player.

Willing to work out of our offices in Malta or Barcelona, or on remote as part of our distributed workforce.

A nice person that can bear conversations about unicorns.

A Backend Java Developer at Casumo

Is native in Java, but speaks and writes Bash, SQL and Python. If you have any experience with Kotlin, Scala or Javascript it’s not impossible that you’ll get to practice that too.

Has an interest both in the big picture and for the small details, a key to work in our tightly knit team.

Likes freedom with responsibility and would feel comfortable in an environment of developer anarchy.

Has a desire to take full ownership of features and code, from inception of ideas to deployment, maintenance and keeping it running.

Appreciates the concepts and principles underlying open-source culture and good software development.

Is a person who loves to play with code, understands the need of quality and cares about it

Gets curious when we say CQRS, Event Sourcing or MicroServices. Feels very comfortable in a Linux environment and working with tools like Git.

It’s a plus if you have experience with transaction-heavy, distributed systems, messaging, MicroServices or tools such as MySQL, RabbitMQ, Docker, Spring, Dropwizard or Jenkins/TeamCity.

Would be stoked to build the world’s best gaming experience together with other Casumos from our headquarters in sunny Malta, Barcelona or on remote.

About Casumo

Casumo is a recognized and award-winning online casino formed in 2012. We’re a bunch of nerdy game enthusiasts who believe that the right people, tools and technology drive innovation and have the potential to disrupt entire industries. With our passion for games we’re on a mission to create a better reality for the many people through play and we’re always looking for like-minded to join our adventure.

We’re a flat organization which means we stay away from unnecessary titles and corporate gibberish. We believe in hiring great people and get out of their way, and that’s where you come in. Being different is good, and our mantra “You’re weird, I like you”, helps us keeping things fresh, original and playful. Our work style is characterized by transparency, humbleness, speed and an entrepreneurial culture, with autonomous, cross-functional teams working closely together towards a clear vision. We never stop playing and we never stop learning. Together, we’re writing the future of gaming. Are you ready for a new adventure?

Perks and benefits @ Casumo

Dreamy office locations

Enjoy sun, beautiful surroundings and a welcoming culture

Great health and medical plans

If something happens to you, we’ve got your back

Legendary company trips

We work, twerk and celebrate our goals together with a bang

Weekly office activities

Join the board games club, relax with yoga, play football or just grab a cheeky Friday beer in our bar.

Trust & Flexibility

Work in a flat structure with inspiring colleagues and lots of room to learn and grow

Creativity bonanza

work with like-minded masterminds and the latest tech on building amazing things

items.title: PayrollPanda: Senior Web Developer | Remote
items.content:
Senior Web Developer | Remote

Posted Nov 15

PayrollPanda
Headquarters: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia (South-East Asia)
https://payrollpanda.workable.com/jobs/575413

DESCRIPTION

Our company is growing! We're looking for an awesome full-stack senior developer to work on PayrollPanda - Malaysia's fastest growing cloud Payroll app. It's an exciting time to join a proven group of international entrepreneurs and developers.

REQUIREMENTS

  1. At least 5 years of commercial development experience or you're some kind of genius coder straight out of university.
  2. Extensive experience with web development technologies including Javascript frameworks (preferably Backbone), NodeJS, MongoDB
  3. Agile (Kanban) software development

BENEFITS

  1. REMOTE working - literally work anywhere, our only requirement is that you work at least 4-6 hours during Malaysian working times daily, 9am to 6pm and have fast Internet access.
  2. Live in Malaysia (Optional): If you want to move to Malaysia you are encouraged to apply. We have an international team that all love living here. We will also provide you with a working visa.
  3. Work-life balance: Typically work only 35 hours. Many of us have burnt out before and we want to prevent it happening again to any of our team.
  4. Competitive salary and potential to earn equity. Work with us not for us!

Apply for this position

Apply via: https://payrollpanda.workable.com/jobs/575413

items.title: HashiCorp: Software Engineer - Nomad
items.content:
Software Engineer - Nomad

Posted Nov 14

HashiCorp
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
www.hashicorp.com

On the Nomad team, we develop tools for service deployment and batch job scheduling. Our customers place a high level of trust in us, relying on our tools to operate their own infrastructure and software effectively, and so we care deeply about reliability and performance.

At HashiCorp, we value top-notch collaboration and communication skills, both among internal teams and in how we interact with our users. We take care to balance and be responsive to the needs of our open source community as well as our enterprise level customers.

Engineering at HashiCorp is largely a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.

In your cover letter, please describe why you're interested in working at HashiCorp, and what draws you to this role in particular!  Specifics of your past experience that are relevant to this role are great to include, too.

In this role, you can expect to:

  • Work on next-generation distributed systems for infrastructure management
  • Develop novel algorithms within the context of our open source tools
  • Build and architect systems for managing extremely large-scale global fleets of resources
  • Interface directly with internal teams, users and HashiCorp customers, and represent HashiCorp well to the large Nomad community
  • Own the full lifecycle of feature development from design through testing and release
  • Program mostly in Golang, learning from and contributing to a team committed to continually improving their skills

You may be a good fit for our team if:

  • You’re familiar with systems engineering, with networking and operating systems, and are comfortable with low-level programming
  • You have prior experience working in high performance or distributed systems; while we strive to hire at a variety of experience levels, this particular opening is not well-suited for recent graduates
  • You can knowledgeably discuss tradeoffs in distributed systems, such as those made for debugging and performance
  • You're familiar with the pieces of typical modern infrastructure: secret storage, service discovery, etc
  • You’re able to reason about performance, security, and user interactions in complex systems
At HashiCorp, we are committed to hiring and cultivating a diverse team. If you are on the fence about whether you meet our requirements, please apply anyway!

Apply for this position

https://www.hashicorp.com/jobs/825723

items.title: HashiCorp: Software Engineer - Consul Frontend
items.content:
Software Engineer - Consul Frontend

Posted Nov 14

HashiCorp
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
https://www.hashicorp.com/jobs/900941

On the Consul team, we develop tools for service discovery, config management, and health monitoring. Our customers place a high level of trust in us, relying on our tools to operate their own infrastructure and software effectively, so we care deeply about reliability and performance.

At HashiCorp, we value top-notch collaboration and communication skills, both among internal teams and in how we interact with our users. We take care to balance and be responsive to the needs of our open source community as well as our enterprise level customers.

Engineering at HashiCorp is largely a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.

In your cover letter, please describe why you're interested in working at HashiCorp, and what draws you to this role in particular!  Specifics of your past experience that are relevant to this role are great to include, too.

In this role, you can expect to:

  • Lead development of an Ember.js front end application, improving on the existing widely deployed UI
  • Proactively work closely with frontend engineers across teams spanning the HashiCorp product line--coordinating and collaborating on design decisions and best practices
  • Build, iterate, and ship features to make working with Consul a fantastic experience for HashiCorp customers
  • Help own automated testing of the Ember.js application
  • Interface directly with internal teams, users, and HashiCorp customers, and represent HashiCorp well to the large Consul community

You may be a good fit for our team if:

  • You have a general familiarity with infrastructure management concepts
  • You have experience running, testing, and contributing to a complex front-end application built on a current JavaScript framework--Ember.js experience is a big plus
  • You are comfortable with HTML (and templating languages such as Handlebars and ERB), and CSS (including preprocessors such as SASS)
  • UI and UX design experience for web applications is a plus
  • Golang experience is also a plus, if you are interested in occasionally contributing to the Consul backend code
 

At HashiCorp, we are committed to hiring and cultivating a diverse team. If you are on the fence about whether you meet our requirements, please apply anyway!

Apply for this position

https://www.hashicorp.com/jobs/900941

items.title: Pixelcabin: Junior front-end developer
items.content:
Junior front-end developer

Posted Nov 14

Pixelcabin
Headquarters: London
https://pixelcabin.io/#hiring

About Pixelcabin

Pixelcabin is an agile web development agency, focusing on ecommerce solutions for a wide range of companies. We work closely with Shopify building polished front-end experiences for our clients, and expanding the native Shopify functionality with bespoke Rails apps that leverage Shopify’s extensive API. We are a core Partner of Shopify, with advance access to upcoming APIs and features, allowing our projects to deliver cutting-edge solutions.

Our team is small and fully distributed, and working remotely has been part of our DNA since Day 1, meaning you’ll find a great remote working environment focused around making your day-to-day enjoyable and efficient, using tools like Slack for communication, Github for code, Rubymine IDE, Pivotal Tracker for project management, amongst many others. As part of a remote team, we encourage finding a setup that provides both the work productivity and lifestyle that suits everyone, even if that is something completely different for each person. Without geographic constraints, time and location can be flexible to fit around each team member’s needs.

As our clients are also remote, we occasionally travel to spend time embedded in their offices, and this can also provide us as a team time to come together. Outside of these trips, we also organise an annual meetup to bring everyone together for a few days to get away from our desks, bridge the remote-working gap, and plan for the future direction of the company - our last meetup was in California, fresh off the back of the annual Shopify Unite conference.

The company has evolved around a few core principles: quality over quantity, under-promise and over-deliver, and taking pride in your work. We take on projects that will present new problems for us to solve, and get excited about elegant solutions to complex problems. Most importantly, we want to invest in our team - we encourage continuous learning and development and aim for a high degree of code-review as part of the day-to-day experience.

About you

We are seeking a Junior front-end developer with a keen eye for UI and UX design to help us grow our team. You will be exposed to a variety of different web apps and e-commerce front-end builds (predominantly on the Shopify platform), and given ownership of some upcoming projects currently in the planning stage.

An ideal candidate will be highly self-motivated, able to take initiative in solving problems, and someone that can take ownership of projects, without needing to be micromanaged. You will need to be comfortable translating wireframes into a highly intuitive interface, whilst being able to suggest and implement UX improvements in an agile way as you build and receive feedback from the team and stakeholders. Working as part of a remote team has many great advantages, however you will be expected to be able to communicate clearly with the team over a variety of different mediums (including daily video calls, demoing wireframes via Invision, etc), take a task through to completion, and be comfortable with raising issues or questions along the way.

As a remote team across time zones, we have a flexible approach to work schedule, however we would usually expect you to cross at least 5 hours of 8am - 6pm Monday to Friday GMT+0 during your first year of working with us.
We favour a CS background over any specific language or technology skills, but as part of this we would expect a foundational understanding in HTML, Javascript, Scss / Sass, the modern web and Git.

Required knowledge and experience

  • Familiarity with Javascript, writing semantic markup and using a preprocessor such as Sass, as well as proficiency with Git
  • Some experience working with Grunt / Gulp workflows
  • Strong verbal and written communication in English
  • Exceedingly detail-oriented – for you, a UI build is not complete until it looks pixel perfect
  • Naturally organized and self-directed

Desirable knowledge and experience

  • Experience with writing in ES6 syntax and using Webpack
  • Experience with the Shopify platform
  • Contributions to open-source projects
  • Some experience with Ruby on Rails and / or React

Salaries and Perks

  • Starting salary £25k - £32k
  • Flexible workspace allowance
  • Professional Development allowance
  • Team retreats in a different global location each year - Hong Kong for April 2018!

Pixelcabin is committed to being a culturally diverse team, and we value a broad set of opinions and perspectives. As we grow, we strive to build a company with a broad set of viewpoints at its core, and we encourage applications from female and minority candidates.

Apply for this position

We are looking for direct candidates only (no agencies please) - to apply, send your application to jobs@pixelcabin.io, including your Github, LinkedIn, and any other relevant links, before the application deadline of 14th December.

items.title: Frontend developer @ Tidelift
items.content:
Frontend developer @ Tidelift

2017-11-14 20:14

Description

At Tidelift, we are helping open source developers and users work together to build better software. We see a world where everyone wins—where open source developers have abundant reasons to keep innovating and maintaining their creations and open source users get software they can depend on.

This is an opportunity to shape the culture of a new team while building a product from scratch. Our company is well-funded and you'll have the support you need to make things happen. After a few years with us, you'd be able to say you were one of the first members of the team and that you had primary responsibility for building a new product.

About you

We’re looking for a frontend developer; someone at home in the browser, crafting JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. We would love to meet you if you have a second competency as well, which could be visual design, interaction design, backend development, or perhaps some skills you have which we haven’t thought of.

If you aren’t a visual designer yourself, we’d like you to work closely with a designer to implement a product that looks great.

We are eager to consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

In this role, you would have the option to work remotely from a US time zone, or from our office in Boston. We’ll discuss other flexible arrangements as well, let us know what you need.

About our team

We’re just getting started, but here’s the goal. We’d like to build a product development team passionate about making a difference to others, with relevant software that helps people. Here’s a team assessment that spoke to us: https://hackernoon.com/product-development-team-self-assessment-c3707f065069Wouldn’t it be nice to score highly on those measures?

Our goal is that everyone on the team cares about users, cares about business context, cares about design, and cares about one another. We want to hire people who get along with others and care deeply about how their work will be used.

Our backend stack will be mostly Ruby (we don’t require Ruby for this frontend developer role, but of course we’d be happy to give you opportunities to learn it if you want!).

Our company aims for work-life harmony; we believe in doing good work, with urgency and pragmatism, but at a sustainable pace. We do not expect long hours, but we do strive to have an impact.

How to apply

Fill out the form below. We'd love it if you include a thoughtful note about your goals and your background. We’ll get back to you!

Country

Anywhere*

Location

items.title: Frontend developer
items.content:
At Tidelift, we are helping open source developers and users work together to build better software. We see a world where everyone wins—where open source developers have abundant reasons to keep innovating and maintaining their creations and open source users get software they can depend on.

This is an opportunity to shape the culture of a new team while building a product from scratch. Our company is well-funded and you'll have the support you need to make things happen. After a few years with us, you'd be able to say you were one of the first members of the team and that you had primary responsibility for building a new product.

About you

We’re looking for a frontend developer; someone at home in the browser, crafting JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. We would love to meet you if you have a second competency as well, which could be visual design, interaction design, backend development, or perhaps some skills you have which we haven’t thought of.

If you aren’t a visual designer yourself, we’d like you to work closely with a designer to implement a product that looks great.

We are eager to consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

In this role, you would have the option to work remotely from a US time zone, or from our office in Boston. We’ll discuss other flexible arrangements as well, let us know what you need.

About our team

We’re just getting started, but here’s the goal. We’d like to build a product development team passionate about making a difference to others, with relevant software that helps people. Here’s a team assessment that spoke to us: https://hackernoon.com/product-development-team-self-assessment-c3707f065069Wouldn’t it be nice to score highly on those measures?

Our goal is that everyone on the team cares about users, cares about business context, cares about design, and cares about one another. We want to hire people who get along with others and care deeply about how their work will be used.

Our backend stack will be mostly Ruby (we don’t require Ruby for this frontend developer role, but of course we’d be happy to give you opportunities to learn it if you want!).

Our company aims for work-life harmony; we believe in doing good work, with urgency and pragmatism, but at a sustainable pace. We do not expect long hours, but we do strive to have an impact.

How to apply

Fill out the form below. We'd love it if you include a thoughtful note about your goals and your background. We’ll get back to you!

You MUST be a modern, polyglot web app developer
You MUST be HIGHLY experienced and successful building effective apps in the FaceBook ecosystem

Apply for this position

items.title: Redox: Full Stack Software Engineer
items.content:
Full Stack Software Engineer

Posted Nov 14

Redox
Headquarters: Madison, WI - Remote USA
https://www.redoxengine.com/

Redox is an engineering-first company, building the future of healthcare information exchange.  We are looking for an experienced Software Developer to join our small and fast-paced team. In this position, you'll be creating the communication platform used by the entire healthcare software developer community.

At Redox, we have a culture of trust, transparency and tireless personal growth.

Please Apply If You Are:
  • Passionate about solving complex problems and doing good
  • Intellectually curious with a genuine desire to learn
  • Experienced programming in *some* language
  • A good listener who shows respect to your colleagues
  • A believer in asking for forgiveness, not permission
  • Comfortable with uncertainty and turning complex problems into actionable plans

Responsibilities:
  • Ship elegant code
  • Ship functional features
  • Ship features often
  • Develop for the future
  • Manage your own work, yet collaborate and support your fellow team members

Preferred Experience:
  • Shipping and maintaining large-scale HA cloud applications
  • Developing/Authoring APIs or Data Schemas
  • Healthcare Experience/Interest
  • Infrastructure or AWS Experience

Our Tech
We use Angular on the front-end and node on the backend; Postgres for our main DB store and Redis to manage coordinating among our various processes. We are committed to unit testing, peer code review, and continuous deployment. Check out our full stack here: https://stackshare.io/redox-engine/redox-engine

Apply for this position

Apply through our careers page: https://www.redoxengine.com/developer-application

items.title: Full Time: Frontend React JavaScript Engineer at Trumid Technologies LLC in New York (Remote)
items.content:
The Company

Trumid is a financial technology company bringing efficiency to credit trading through data, technology and elegantly crafted products. Trumid Market Center, the company’s all-to-all electronic trading and market intelligence platform for corporate bonds, provides market professionals with direct access to anonymous liquidity.

We’re a Wall Street startup founded in 2014 and backed by Peter Thiel and George Soros, seeking an experienced Frontend React developer. We’re leading-edge in our technology approach, and offer the option to work onsite at our New York office or Remote from anywhere. Our institutional credit trading platform has a Scala microservices architecture with multiple Electron-based frontend applications.

Trumid offers excellent compensation and benefits. A Computer Science degree is preferred but not required. We are looking for someone who can demonstrate ability to keep up with the latest best-practices in the fast-moving JavaScript ecosystem.

Role responsibilities:

  • Design, implement and optimize our flagship Market Center application to improve trader experience and drive revenue
  • Work with our business team, designers and clients to deliver world-class UIs
  • Be a driving force for the adoption of modern UI architecture and best-practices on a fast-paced team environment

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript, and web UI architecture and frameworks
  • Experience building React frontend applications for production systems
  • Familiarity with Redux and middleware for asynchronous action handling
  • Understanding of reactive socket-streaming application development
  • Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases, and handling of large data sets
  • Solid understanding of HTML5/CSS3 web technologies
  • Software development experience with github, jira, jenkins, in a *nix environment
  • A passion for marketplaces and high-performance computing

Please submit a professional statement, LinkedIn profile or resume, and github or blog URL to careers@trumidtech.com to apply.

items.title: PhishMe: UI Lead Engineer
items.content:
UI Lead Engineer

Posted Nov 14

PhishMe
Headquarters: Leesburg, VA
phishme.com/company/careers

Reporting to the Director of Software Engineering, the Lead UI Engineer is responsible for assisting with the technical oversight of the front-end architecture for the Triage product line at PhishMe. 

PhishMe provides end-to-end cyber-defense solutions that help protect organizations and their people from the vast and growing threat posed by phishing-related attacks. We're expanding rapidly and looking for talented engineers, like you, that care about building great products that solve big problems.
In this role, you will lead our efforts to rethink, refactor, and rebuild the foundations that support the front-end. You will bring to bear your passion for design and engineering towards the creation of functional and elegant experiences for our users. Working with Product Management, UX and front-end engineering teams, you will drive forward the four pillars of front-end architecture: code, documentation, testing, and process. (Ref: Micah Godbolt's collection of thoughts on Front-End Architecture: https://github.com/micahgodbolt/front-end-architecture)
  • Collaborate with the engineering teams and other stakeholders on new product features providing feasibility and estimation detail.
  • Support creation and maintenance of the technical roadmap for each product, providing relevant documentation and detail of the investments necessary to reach goals.
  • Support front-end development teams to establish shared coding standards, consistent code quality, and continuous improvement.
  • Effective communication is key and you should be able to modulate your approach to specific audiences both technical and non-technical.
  • Architecture level technical oversight of the front-end for multiple products, you will lay the groundwork for development of elegant, robust user experiences using a modern approach to the web.
  • Coordinate with back-end platform and API teams to understand impact and integrate with existing and future APIs.
  • Other duties as assigned.

The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:

 

  • Deep understanding of JavaScript as a language and its ecosystem, especially as it relates to front-end development for the web.
  • Familiar with multiple JavaScript frameworks like Vue.Js, ReAct.Js, Ember and Angular.
  • Longstanding familiarity with the JavaScript community -- you stay on top of current news and changes to the language and framework landscape.
  • Proficient in HTML and CSS with knowledge of web standards, advanced layouts, and responsive design.
  • Comfortable with various build tools, template languages, and pre-processors.
  • Maintains a test-centric approach to development in order to build and deploy with confidence.
  • Familiarity with component based approaches to front-end applications.
  • Demonstrated ability to make and support technical decisions as well as craft a technical roadmap to support investments to achieve a specific long term vision.
  • Excellent understanding of browser security and performance.
  • Experience with cross-browser compatibility and relevant shims, fallbacks, and polyfills.
  • Passionate about design and the creation of elegant and functional user experiences.
  • Have worked in Agile organizations in the past and participated in a Scrum or Kanban team.

Education and/or Experience:

  • At least 8 years of professional experience in software engineering preferred.
  • Recent production experience building, maintaining, and deploying client-side JavaScript applications using one or more frameworks (e.g. Vue.js, React, or Ember.js).
  • Experience with Vue.js preferred.
  • Experience in one or more languages beyond JavaScript, Java preferred.

Qualities We Care Deeply About:

  • Fun to work with.
  • Love to share and collaborate.
  • Committed to continuous improvement and learning.
  • Work ethic and desire to see things through.

Why Working With Us Is Awesome

  • People - smart, caring, and collaborative
  • Benefits - competitive salary along with 401k (w/company match), health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecommute - flexible, remote first teams
  • Impact - working on products that protect organizations and their people that are used by over half the Fortune 100
Compensation

  • Competitive salary and incentive stock options
  • 401k with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, life insurance
  • Telecom expense reimbursement

Location

  • Telecommute (US Only)

PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position, please follow the link below:https://careers-phishme.icims.com/jobs/1550/ui-lead-engineer/job?mode=view

items.title: Mobile Software Engineer @ Participate
items.content:
Mobile Software Engineer @ Participate

2017-11-14 16:48

Description

Your talents and experience as a mobile software developer will complement our team’s abilities to build a great product, www.participate.com — a platform designed to provide real-time, collaborative learning experiences for educators. You will help build innovative new features to provide our users the tools to develop their skills and collaborate with others in their field.

Participate helps teachers connect and collaborate with educators around the world to discover new resources and ideas they can incorporate into their instruction. Our collaborative professional development tools provide growth opportunities for educators that are rooted in discussion and creative, critical thinking. Participate promotes engaging learning environments, empowers teachers and inspires students to create impact on a global scale. Participate is committed to ensuring inclusive, equitable learning for all.

Our agile development team is extremely collaborative and supportive; we help each other to do our best work. As a talented and experienced software developer with experience in developing and maintaining consumer apps, you’d plug into the team and find a place to grow and learn, and help teach others so we can all continue to deliver functional and engaging software for our users.

You:

  • Collaborate well with others, and generally say "We" instead of "I"
  • Effectively review code and enjoy the process of others reviewing yours
  • Strive to improve your coding practices and those of your team
  • Proactively chip away at technical debt, and identify opportunities for infrastructural improvements
  • Feel pain when repetitive tasks aren't automated
  • Are passionate about new technologies in software development
  • Manage your time effectively, and recognize the line that denotes "good enough"
  • Are comfortable working in a remote environment
  • Passionate about empowering teachers

Technical skills:

  • 3-6 years of native mobile application development experience (Android/Kotlin preferred, Swift a plus)
  • Strong background with UI technologies and front-end development
  • Consumption of JSON and/or GraphQL APIs
  • HTML/CSS
  • Experience with React & Redux (JavaScript/ES6)

Nice to have:

  • Experience supporting the entire application lifecycle of consumer apps (concept, design, test, release and support)
  • Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market
  • Experience with React Native
  • Experience with Android Studio, Eclipse, or similar IDE
  • Interest or experience with Analytics
  • Experience with agile workflows and continuous integration/deployment

Education & Experience

  • Minimum 2-3 years of relevant professional experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent demonstrable experience

To apply, please follow the link to complete the online application. You will be asked to attach your resume to the online application and have the option of including a cover letter.

United States

Anywhere

items.title: GCP Architects Engineers
items.content: Impekable is actively looking for talented engineers familiar with developing and/or architecting complex solutions utilizing the diverse offerings afforded by Google Cloud Platform (GCP).  We are seeking multiple candidates experienced in planning, implementing, monitoring and servicing/maintaining robust cloud offerings.  Architect related needs are local to Irvine, CA and will require on-site collaboration.  Engineering positions are telecommute capable, but require stringent adherence to Impekable's standards for remote workers.  Currently, as opportunities require a senior level knowledge and will expect commensurate communication prowess and mature understanding of project lifecycles.  Each role has some unique aspects we're looking for, detailed below, as well as a set of general attributes relevant to all roles.

items.title: FULL STACK SOFTWARE ENGINEER / DEVELOPER
items.content:
WHY THE HIRE
We are a funded startup looking for an outstanding software engineer.

SECTOR/PRODUCT
The sector is Robotic Process Automation (RPA) - think ‘big’ robotics + ‘small’ AI. A staggering 35% of jobs are at high risk of automation over next 20 years according to a study by researchers at Oxford University and Deloitte. We will disrupt a £100b sector by developing a SaaS app that automates the efficiency and effectiveness of a specific business process. The sector will be disrupted by someone and we plan to do this first! The CEO has a proven track record in this field and a clear vision of the way forward.

STARTUP STATUS
I am a very experienced/ successful CEO founder looking for a Software Engineer to join me. The product is fully mocked-up, there is a business plan and funding is in place.

ROLE
Software Engineer/ Full Stack Developer to join this early stage startup as the first tech hire alongside the founder. Framework includes AWS, Aurora (MySQL), Python, Nginx, Vue.js express,

QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE
* University degree or higher
* 2+ years professional Software Engineering Experience in relevant technology
* Job tenure [evidence that you stick with a role]
* Strong references
* Demonstrable track record
* Proven experience in web app development
* Experience in Python, SQL, Vue.js [or willing learn may be an option]

LOCATION
South UK. Work from home/ co-working hub TBA. We will set up an office in the coming months.

EQUITY
There is equity for this role as well as salary. Your outstanding talent will be rewarded - and you can dial this up by adjusting mix of salary and equity if desired…

YOU
* Outstanding at software
* Passionate about building software for a SaaS start up
* Want to generate serious wealth
* Hard working
* Dedicated and resourceful engineer
* Willing to learn technologies/ skills needed
* Authorized to work in the UK
* Happy to work from home but meet from time to time.

OPPORTUNITY
This is an amazing opportunity to join a disruptive new start-up which is funded. It will suit a developer who wants to generate significant wealth. We have a business plan as well as a full prototype mock-up. You will be able to assess the quality and viability of the venture, under NDA, once we meet.

You can work from home and getting in early means you can become part of the team and get in at ground level helping to define the culture as the company grows. Perhaps you are tired of the corporate world, boring meetings, and want the excitement and creativity of an early stage startup. Work with us if you are a brilliant developer looking for the next big thing! If you have the experience and drive to get the job done, I look forward to hearing from you. Please get in touch.

items.title: Technical Instructor - Workday - Home Based
items.content:
Technical Instructor
Workday -Home Based
Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

Job Description

Job DescriptionWorkday's Knowledge Management group is looking for professional Instructors who have experience that runs the entire gamut of training -- from course concept to development to delivery. This position will support our Cross Application tools that include Reporting, Security, Business Process Framework and Integrations.

About the Team

Workday Education is responsible for teaching Workday’s market-leading technology to our partners and customers. Our innovation doesn’t stop with our applications. It continues in our approach to learning. Whether in our state-of-the-art classrooms or other exciting mediums, we work hard to use technology that benefits everyone. Want to learn more? Please visitwww.workdayeducation.com.About the roleAs a Workday Instructor, you will teach and certify Workday and partner consultants and customers to provide them with product expertise. You should be passionate about the quality of what you do with an intense desire to continue to make everything you are involved in better. You should also be ready to work hard but have a lot of fun doing it!You will have the ability to define the course requirements, create the course deliverables, and see the work through, including delivery of the course. This position requires the ability to collaborate with Development and Product Management to ensure accuracy of course content and use of functionality, and Professional Services and Product Support for relevancy of course offerings.You will• Become an expert in the Workday reporting and integration tools• Teach a variety of classes, both Instructor Led and Virtual Instructor Led• Collaborate with content development team to define course structure, content, and delivery method to produce high quality training• Obtain a deep knowledge of Workday applications and work across functional teams to stay current with rapidly evolving enhancements• Build relationships across teams to meet goals• Learn and quickly master new product functionality• Share your knowledge and experience with your students to get their Workday career off to a great start!This position can be located in any metro market.About YouThe ideal candidate will be able to teach the Workday reporting and integration tools to diverse audiences, including customers, implementation consultants, partners, and application developers.You should be passionate about the quality of what you do with an intense desire to continue to make everything you are involved in better. You should also be ready to work hard but have a lot of fun doing it!Our successful candidates have a strong background in full scale ERP deployments and training. They work hard, they love to learn, and they are ready for a challenge!You have• 3-5 years implementing reporting and/or integration solutions with Human Resource, Payroll or Financial ERP application software• 3+ years integrating systems with third-party service vendors• Strong technical aptitude, including designing and building reports, a command of Service Oriented Architecture Concepts, experience with EDI, Web Services, XML, XSLT, Java, .Net or other integration technologies, and WebLogic, WebSphere, WebMethods, or other middleware experience• Excellent problem solving skills and the ability to independently manage projects• Ability to communicate concepts in a concise, logical manner so students can absorb and retain• Passion for learning, teaching, and mastering complex system functionality• Ability to comfortably and confidently present to large groups of 20+ people using a variety of delivery methods, for lengthy periods of time• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal• Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training and the flexibility to adapt to a changing environment• Preference will be given to candidates with experience designing, building, and delivering training to a technical audience.• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, relevant working experience is required. Advanced degree preferred.• Some travel will be required (up to 25%)*LI-PF1

items.title: Full Stack Ruby On Rails Developer Seattle Portland Vancouver
items.content: Work with a team of smart, highly productive engineers who care greatly about the code they are shipping. Our culture is very DevOps centric with the goal of bringing the most value we can to our business through a streamlined CI/CD pipeline. Our team champions learning, bettering themselves, and teaching to the rest of the team. In addition to working with a great team and shipping a great leading SaaS product, one day every two weeks you'll invest in yourself. You can use that time to learn about new technologies, contribute to open source, or create side projects that help the company. The position is local Seattle, but will consider remote in Portland or Vancouver.

items.title: Cables & Sensors: IT Project Manager, Background in Web Development, APIs or Shopify
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere - Work will be done remotely)

Who We Are

Cables & Sensors is a highly efficient, fast-growing company that manufactures and distributes accessories for the medical industry in the US and Europe. Although being a small company, we have been awarded with the prestigious Inc 500 Fastest Growing Private Companies in America, ranking at number 377. We are a group of young, smart, perfectionists who love what we do and are proud of being very different from other companies in our industry. We are a high-tech, e-commerce company with a distributed workforce allowing us to work remotely, from our homes of where we most enjoy spending our time. Because we have built an incredibly efficient and organized business, we are very selective about who we hire. If you make it in, we promise you will love working with us.

Summary/Objective

This position will assist the IT Director with daily activities including managing web development teams for current and future projects as well as managing our API-based workflow automation running multiple web applications including Shopify. This role will be responsible for maintaining and writing software specification documents, documenting processes, managing projects and basic coding. This position requires a high level of organization, creativity and excellent communication with a wide variety of people. It also requires the ability to properly manage time and prioritize as well as making many decisions and/or know when to consult others on them. This person must have prior experience managing development projects be very comfortable with web technologies such as API connections and the Shopify platform.

Essential Functions

  1. Interacting with external development teams who are developing Cables and Sensors’ IT projects, answering questions and resolving requests

  2. Writing detailed, high-quality specification documentation for new developments

  3. Writing low to mid-level code to maintain current developments, perhaps adding new basic features that can be done in-house

  4. Exploring and identifying new tools and solutions for existing problems or improving current technology

  5. QA testing

  6. Managing timelines for various projects and keeping the teams well informed, coordinated and on schedule

Competencies

  1. Technical capacity to understand complex web developments involving APIs, front end technologies and databases.

  2. Capability to understand and write API documentation

  3. Thoroughness, the candidate must be detailed oriented and capable of following complex projects until their completion.

  4. Time management, capability to prioritize important tasks and manage large volumes of data.

  5. Communication proficiency, capability to easily communicate with remote teams by phone and email.

  6. Self-driven, motivated and capable of managing his or her own time and work.

Supervisory Responsibility

This position will supervise external, remote development teams.

Work Environment

This job is a remote position. All office and computer equipment required to perform its duties will be provided by C&S. A dedicated, quiet location with a strong internet connection at home will be required for this position.

Our team’s management style is very hands off. Each team member knows their responsibilities and has lots of freedom to do the job how they consider best. Because of this (and our remote style of working), excellent communication is very important within the team. With the high level of freedom comes an equal dose of responsibility.

 

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:30AM to 5PM EST. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. If working from a timezone different of US Eastern Standard Time, after a few months of training, independence of working hours can be achieved.

Pace of work is regularly quite high. This does not mean we expect the candidate to be overworked, but rather focused and productive during working hours. We believe that an employee produces best when they have a healthy balance of work and rest (social life, hobbies, family, free time). There will be times when deadlines are at hand and working long hours and weekends will be necessary, as there will also be slow periods when time can be taken off to compensate and take care of self.

Travel

A couple yearly trips might be required to train or work on-site with other team members.

Required Experience

Pre-requisites:

  1. 3+ years experience in development such as Javascript, Ruby on Rails, Shopify or API development

  2. 2+ years experience managing web development projects

  3. Experience with time management tools such as Trello, Bugherd, Asana, Slack, Google Docs

  4. Experience managing multiple, complex, continuous IT projects

  5. Experience writing software documentation

Nice-to-haves:

  1. Basic to medium experience developing APIs and Shopify

  2. Experience managing various IT consultants

  3. Medium to advanced experience with databases

  4. Familiarity with agile project management techniques

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Because C&S is a small, young company, it will be expected, from time to time, for every position in the company to perform tasks that are beyond their job description.

Reports to

Andres Orjuela, IT Director

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
The Company

We're a growth-stage company building a low-code business platform in the cloud.Our recently expanded management team has a track record of success with startups.Development staff work remotely. The company is headquartered near Philly.We enjoy competitive salaries, health benefits, stock options, product ownership, unlimited PTO, and more.

The Stack

Zengine's backend is a REST API, built on a LAMP stack using CakePHP.
Its frontend is a single page app, built using AngularJS.
Its "serverless" plugin architecture is powered by Node.js and AWS Lambda.
The whole stack is Docker native, and continuously delivered to AWS.

You

If you're comfortable in a fast-paced environment, value team collaboration, pride yourself on attention to detail, and are hungry to continually learn, then we want to hear from you.

  • Adherence to coding standards
  • A methodical approach to testing code
  • Knowing when, why & how to refactor
  • Familiarity with application security best practices (esp. OWASP)
  • Understanding of query & request optimization techniques (including experience with complex MySQL operations and distributed caching)
  • Proficiency with common DevOps tooling (containerization, VMs, various AWS services, Logstash + Kibana, etc)

items.title: Contract: Experienced Ruby on Rails Developer at FullStack in Anywhere
items.content:
FullStack is looking for an experienced, passionate, and talented Ruby on Rails developer who can jump in and take ownership of challenging application development and design and architecture problems.Since this is the web, you’ll need be experienced with the usual suspects: JavaScript, CSS, HTML, SQL databases, KV stores, background job processing, etc. Most new projects are built using Ruby on Rails, but it would be great if you have a broad range of web development experience beyond Rails.

We are a distributed team with folks all across the United States, so this is a remote position and we’re looking for contractors with the potential to transition to full-time.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Development of Ruby on Rails applications (Rails 4.x and 5.x)
  • Leading in developing and improving all aspects of our applications (development, testing, deployment, architecture)
  • Architect scalable and performant web applications and APIs
  • Writing well tested, maintainable code.
  • Creation of technical documentation for APIs and component designs
  • Maintain the deployment pipeline and processes for our applications.
  • Providing technical support of applications (fixing bugs and supporting clients' needs).

About FullStack

Our mission is to make our clients incredibly successful by developing and improving ideas into highly functional and usable web applications. Our team has become renowned in our ability to bring creativity, expertise, and sound development practices to notable and ambitious startups. Our development work focuses on architecting and building new applications as well as scaling existing apps for our clients as they grow.

We’re looking for you if you…

  • Have developed libraries, applications, or web sites and want to show them to us (you have code on GitHub, BitBucket, etc.)
  • Have an extensive knowledge of the resources available through Ruby gems and open source libraries.
  • Enjoy working with Rails and have a successful track record of developing applications using it
  • Are equally comfortable with SQL or an ORM and have exposure to a variety of database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB)
  • Have an appreciation for the peace of mind that comes with well-tested, documented code
  • Have exceptional knowledge and experience front-end web technologies (JavaScript, CSS, HTML, etc.)
  • Have experience making decisions regarding application architecture
  • Are excited by the web and keep up with new technologies and that excitement is infectious
  • Communicate well with others in both written and verbal forms
  • Are self-directed and able to manage your time effectively
  • Are able to excel in highly collaborative environment with team based activities including code review and pair programming

Bonus points for…

  • Experience working with an agile / scrum-based development model
  • Having developed on iOS, especially if you have contributed to an app in the App Store
  • Experience working with Javascript MVC frameworks, such as React or AngularJS
  • Working understanding of developing front-end solutions in vanilla javascript
  • A BS or MS in Computer Science, Math or other interesting analytic discipline
  • Development skills with other languages, like PHP or Scala
  • Being comfortable with PaaS hosts like Heroku
  • Familiarity with using Docker in a development environment
  • Experience working with the ActiveAdmin gem
  • Previous history of working with a remote, distributed team
  • Significant contributions to or ownership of open source projects (please do tell!)

Other information about this position

  • Working remotely is how we operate
  • This is a contract position with the possibility of 40+ hours per week.
  • Work visa transfer or sponsorship is not possible at this time
  • We are looking for people located within one of the U.S time zones
